1799 void rorxl(Register dst, Register src, byte imm8);
1800 void rorxl(Register dst, Operand src, byte imm8);
1801
1802 void mfence();
1803 void lfence();
1804 void pause();
1805
1806 // Check the code size generated from label to here.
1807 int SizeOfCodeGeneratedSince(Label* label) {
1808 return pc_offset() - label->pos();
1809 }
1810
1811 // Record a deoptimization reason that can be used by a log or cpu profiler.
1812 // Use --trace-deopt to enable.
1813 void RecordDeoptReason(DeoptimizeReason reason, SourcePosition position,
1814 int id);
1815
1816 // Writes a single word of data in the code stream.
1817 // Used for inline tables, e.g., jump-tables.
1818 void db(uint8_t data);
1819 void dd(uint32_t data);
1820 void dq(uint64_t data);
1821 void dp(uintptr_t data) { dq(data); }
1822 void dq(Label* label);
1823
1824 // Patch entries for partial constant pool.
1825 void PatchConstPool();
1826
1827 // Check if use partial constant pool for this rmode.
1828 static bool UseConstPoolFor(RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
1829
1830 // Check if there is less than kGap bytes available in the buffer.
1831 // If this is the case, we need to grow the buffer before emitting
1832 // an instruction or relocation information.
1833 inline bool buffer_overflow() const {
1834 return pc_ >= reloc_info_writer.pos() - kGap;
1835 }
1836
1837 // Get the number of bytes available in the buffer.
1838 inline int available_space() const {
1839 return static_cast<int>(reloc_info_writer.pos() - pc_);
1840 }
1841
1842 static bool IsNop(Address addr);
1843
1844 // Avoid overflows for displacements etc.
1845 static constexpr int kMaximalBufferSize = 512 * MB;
1846
1847 byte byte_at(int pos) { return buffer_start_[pos]; }
1848 void set_byte_at(int pos, byte value) { buffer_start_[pos] = value; }
1849
1850#if defined(V8_OS_WIN_X64)
1851 win64_unwindinfo::BuiltinUnwindInfo GetUnwindInfo() const;
1852#endif
1853
1854 protected:
1855 // Call near indirect
1856 void call(Operand operand);
1857
1858 private:
1859 Address addr_at(int pos) {
1860 return reinterpret_cast<Address>(buffer_start_ + pos);
1861 }
1862 uint32_t long_at(int pos) {
1863 return ReadUnalignedValue<uint32_t>(addr_at(pos));
1864 }
1865 void long_at_put(int pos, uint32_t x) {
1866 WriteUnalignedValue(addr_at(pos), x);
1867 }
1868
1869 // code emission
1870 void GrowBuffer();
1871
1872 void emit(byte x) { *pc_++ = x; }
1873 inline void emitl(uint32_t x);
1874 inline void emitq(uint64_t x);
1875 inline void emitw(uint16_t x);
1876 inline void emit_runtime_entry(Address entry, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
1877 inline void emit(Immediate x);
1878 inline void emit(Immediate64 x);
1879
1880 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1881 // the top bit of both register codes.
1882 // High bit of reg goes to REX.R, high bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1883 // REX.W is set.
1884 inline void emit_rex_64(XMMRegister reg, Register rm_reg);
1885 inline void emit_rex_64(Register reg, XMMRegister rm_reg);
1886 inline void emit_rex_64(Register reg, Register rm_reg);
1887 inline void emit_rex_64(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister rm_reg);
1888
1889 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1890 // the top bit of the destination, index, and base register codes.
1891 // The high bit of reg is used for REX.R, the high bit of op's base
1892 // register is used for REX.B, and the high bit of op's index register
1893 // is used for REX.X. REX.W is set.
1894 inline void emit_rex_64(Register reg, Operand op);
1895 inline void emit_rex_64(XMMRegister reg, Operand op);
1896
1897 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1898 // the top bit of the register code.
1899 // The high bit of register is used for REX.B.
1900 // REX.W is set and REX.R and REX.X are clear.
1901 inline void emit_rex_64(Register rm_reg);
1902
1903 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1904 // the top bit of the index and base register codes.
1905 // The high bit of op's base register is used for REX.B, and the high
1906 // bit of op's index register is used for REX.X.
1907 // REX.W is set and REX.R clear.
1908 inline void emit_rex_64(Operand op);
1909
1910 // Emit a REX prefix that only sets REX.W to choose a 64-bit operand size.
1911 void emit_rex_64() { emit(0x48); }
1912
1913 // High bit of reg goes to REX.R, high bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1914 // REX.W is clear.
1915 inline void emit_rex_32(Register reg, Register rm_reg);
1916
1917 // The high bit of reg is used for REX.R, the high bit of op's base
1918 // register is used for REX.B, and the high bit of op's index register
1919 // is used for REX.X. REX.W is cleared.
1920 inline void emit_rex_32(Register reg, Operand op);
1921
1922 // High bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1923 // REX.W, REX.R and REX.X are clear.
1924 inline void emit_rex_32(Register rm_reg);
1925
1926 // High bit of base goes to REX.B and high bit of index to REX.X.
1927 // REX.W and REX.R are clear.
1928 inline void emit_rex_32(Operand op);
1929
1930 // High bit of reg goes to REX.R, high bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1931 // REX.W is cleared. If no REX bits are set, no byte is emitted.
1932 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register reg, Register rm_reg);
1933
1934 // The high bit of reg is used for REX.R, the high bit of op's base
1935 // register is used for REX.B, and the high bit of op's index register
1936 // is used for REX.X. REX.W is cleared. If no REX bits are set, nothing
1937 // is emitted.
1938 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register reg, Operand op);
1939
1940 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Register), except that
1941 // the registers are XMM registers.
1942 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister base);
1943
1944 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Register), except that
1945 // one of the registers is an XMM registers.
1946 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister reg, Register base);
1947
1948 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Register), except that
1949 // one of the registers is an XMM registers.
1950 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register reg, XMMRegister base);
1951
1952 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Operand), except that
1953 // the register is an XMM register.
1954 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister reg, Operand op);
1955
1956 // Optionally do as emit_rex_32(Register) if the register number has
1957 // the high bit set.
1958 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register rm_reg);
1959 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister rm_reg);
1960
1961 // Optionally do as emit_rex_32(Operand) if the operand register
1962 // numbers have a high bit set.
1963 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Operand op);
1964
1965 // Calls emit_rex_32(Register) for all non-byte registers.
1966 inline void emit_optional_rex_8(Register reg);
1967
1968 // Calls emit_rex_32(Register, Operand) for all non-byte registers, and
1969 // emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Operand) for byte registers.
1970 inline void emit_optional_rex_8(Register reg, Operand op);
1971
1972 void emit_rex(int size) {
1973 if (size == kInt64Size) {
1974 emit_rex_64();
1975 } else {
1976 DCHECK_EQ(size, kInt32Size)((void) 0);
1977 }
1978 }
1979
1980 template <class P1>
1981 void emit_rex(P1 p1, int size) {
1982 if (size == kInt64Size) {
1983 emit_rex_64(p1);
1984 } else {
1985 DCHECK_EQ(size, kInt32Size)((void) 0);
1986 emit_optional_rex_32(p1);
1987 }
1988 }
1989
1990 template <class P1, class P2>
1991 void emit_rex(P1 p1, P2 p2, int size) {
1992 if (size == kInt64Size) {
1993 emit_rex_64(p1, p2);
1994 } else {
1995 DCHECK_EQ(size, kInt32Size)((void) 0);
1996 emit_optional_rex_32(p1, p2);
1997 }
1998 }
1999
2000 // Emit vex prefix
2001 void emit_vex2_byte0() { emit(0xc5); }
2002 inline void emit_vex2_byte1(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister v, VectorLength l,
2003 SIMDPrefix pp);
2004 void emit_vex3_byte0() { emit(0xc4); }
2005 inline void emit_vex3_byte1(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister rm, LeadingOpcode m);
2006 inline void emit_vex3_byte1(XMMRegister reg, Operand rm, LeadingOpcode m);
2007 inline void emit_vex3_byte2(VexW w, XMMRegister v, VectorLength l,
2008 SIMDPrefix pp);
2009 inline void emit_vex_prefix(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister v, XMMRegister rm,
2010 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2011 VexW w);
2012 inline void emit_vex_prefix(Register reg, Register v, Register rm,
2013 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2014 VexW w);
2015 inline void emit_vex_prefix(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister v, Operand rm,
2016 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2017 VexW w);
2018 inline void emit_vex_prefix(Register reg, Register v, Operand rm,
2019 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2020 VexW w);
2021
2022 // Emit the ModR/M byte, and optionally the SIB byte and
2023 // 1- or 4-byte offset for a memory operand. Also encodes
2024 // the second operand of the operation, a register or operation
2025 // subcode, into the reg field of the ModR/M byte.
2026 void emit_operand(Register reg, Operand adr) {
2027 emit_operand(reg.low_bits(), adr);
2028 }
2029
2030 // Emit the ModR/M byte, and optionally the SIB byte and
2031 // 1- or 4-byte offset for a memory operand. Also used to encode
2032 // a three-bit opcode extension into the ModR/M byte.
2033 void emit_operand(int rm, Operand adr);
2034
2035 // Emit a ModR/M byte with registers coded in the reg and rm_reg fields.
2036 void emit_modrm(Register reg, Register rm_reg) {
2037 emit(0xC0 | reg.low_bits() << 3 | rm_reg.low_bits());
2038 }
2039
2040 // Emit a ModR/M byte with an operation subcode in the reg field and
2041 // a register in the rm_reg field.
2042 void emit_modrm(int code, Register rm_reg) {
2043 DCHECK(is_uint3(code))((void) 0);
2044 emit(0xC0 | code << 3 | rm_reg.low_bits());
2045 }
2046
2047 // Emit the code-object-relative offset of the label's position
2048 inline void emit_code_relative_offset(Label* label);
2049
2050 // The first argument is the reg field, the second argument is the r/m field.
2051 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src);
2052 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister reg, Operand adr);
2053 void emit_sse_operand(Register reg, Operand adr);
2054 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister dst, Register src);
2055 void emit_sse_operand(Register dst, XMMRegister src);
2056 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister dst);
2057
2058 // Emit machine code for one of the operations ADD, ADC, SUB, SBC,
2059 // AND, OR, XOR, or CMP. The encodings of these operations are all
2060 // similar, differing just in the opcode or in the reg field of the
2061 // ModR/M byte.
2062 void arithmetic_op_8(byte opcode, Register reg, Register rm_reg);
2063 void arithmetic_op_8(byte opcode, Register reg, Operand rm_reg);
2064 void arithmetic_op_16(byte opcode, Register reg, Register rm_reg);
2065 void arithmetic_op_16(byte opcode, Register reg, Operand rm_reg);
2066 // Operate on operands/registers with pointer size, 32-bit or 64-bit size.
2067 void arithmetic_op(byte opcode, Register reg, Register rm_reg, int size);
2068 void arithmetic_op(byte opcode, Register reg, Operand rm_reg, int size);
2069 // Operate on a byte in memory or register.
2070 void immediate_arithmetic_op_8(byte subcode, Register dst, Immediate src);
2071 void immediate_arithmetic_op_8(byte subcode, Operand dst, Immediate src);
2072 // Operate on a word in memory or register.
2073 void immediate_arithmetic_op_16(byte subcode, Register dst, Immediate src);
2074 void immediate_arithmetic_op_16(byte subcode, Operand dst, Immediate src);
2075 // Operate on operands/registers with pointer size, 32-bit or 64-bit size.
2076 void immediate_arithmetic_op(byte subcode, Register dst, Immediate src,
2077 int size);
2078 void immediate_arithmetic_op(byte subcode, Operand dst, Immediate src,
2079 int size);
2080
2081 // Emit machine code for a shift operation.
2082 void shift(Operand dst, Immediate shift_amount, int subcode, int size);
2083 void shift(Register dst, Immediate shift_amount, int subcode, int size);
2084 // Shift dst by cl % 64 bits.
2085 void shift(Register dst, int subcode, int size);
2086 void shift(Operand dst, int subcode, int size);
2087
2088 void emit_farith(int b1, int b2, int i);
2089
2090 // labels
2091 // void print(Label* L);
2092 void bind_to(Label* L, int pos);
2093
2094 // record reloc info for current pc_
2095 void RecordRelocInfo(RelocInfo::Mode rmode, intptr_t data = 0);
2096
2097 // Arithmetics
2098 void emit_add(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2099 arithmetic_op(0x03, dst, src, size);
2100 }
2101
2102 void emit_add(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2103 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x0, dst, src, size);
2104 }
2105
2106 void emit_add(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2107 arithmetic_op(0x03, dst, src, size);
2108 }
2109
2110 void emit_add(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2111 arithmetic_op(0x1, src, dst, size);
2112 }
2113
2114 void emit_add(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2115 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x0, dst, src, size);
2116 }
2117
2118 void emit_and(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2119 arithmetic_op(0x23, dst, src, size);
2120 }
2121
2122 void emit_and(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2123 arithmetic_op(0x23, dst, src, size);
2124 }
2125
2126 void emit_and(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2127 arithmetic_op(0x21, src, dst, size);
2128 }
2129
2130 void emit_and(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2131 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x4, dst, src, size);
2132 }
2133
2134 void emit_and(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2135 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x4, dst, src, size);
2136 }
2137
2138 void emit_cmp(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2139 arithmetic_op(0x3B, dst, src, size);
2140 }
2141
2142 void emit_cmp(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2143 arithmetic_op(0x3B, dst, src, size);
2144 }
2145
2146 void emit_cmp(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2147 arithmetic_op(0x39, src, dst, size);
2148 }
2149
2150 void emit_cmp(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2151 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x7, dst, src, size);
2152 }
2153
2154 void emit_cmp(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2155 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x7, dst, src, size);
2156 }
2157
2158 // Compare {al,ax,eax,rax} with src. If equal, set ZF and write dst into
2159 // src. Otherwise clear ZF and write src into {al,ax,eax,rax}. This
2160 // operation is only atomic if prefixed by the lock instruction.
2161 void emit_cmpxchg(Operand dst, Register src, int size);
2162
2163 void emit_dec(Register dst, int size);
2164 void emit_dec(Operand dst, int size);
2165
2166 // Divide rdx:rax by src. Quotient in rax, remainder in rdx when size is 64.
2167 // Divide edx:eax by lower 32 bits of src. Quotient in eax, remainder in edx
2168 // when size is 32.
2169 void emit_idiv(Register src, int size);
2170 void emit_div(Register src, int size);
2171
2172 // Signed multiply instructions.
2173 // rdx:rax = rax * src when size is 64 or edx:eax = eax * src when size is 32.
2174 void emit_imul(Register src, int size);
2175 void emit_imul(Operand src, int size);
2176 void emit_imul(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2177 void emit_imul(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2178 void emit_imul(Register dst, Register src, Immediate imm, int size);
2179 void emit_imul(Register dst, Operand src, Immediate imm, int size);
2180
2181 void emit_inc(Register dst, int size);
2182 void emit_inc(Operand dst, int size);
2183
2184 void emit_lea(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2185
2186 void emit_mov(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2187 void emit_mov(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2188 void emit_mov(Operand dst, Register src, int size);
2189 void emit_mov(Register dst, Immediate value, int size);
2190 void emit_mov(Operand dst, Immediate value, int size);
2191 void emit_mov(Register dst, Immediate64 value, int size);
2192
2193 void emit_movzxb(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2194 void emit_movzxb(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2195 void emit_movzxw(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2196 void emit_movzxw(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2197
2198 void emit_neg(Register dst, int size);
2199 void emit_neg(Operand dst, int size);
2200
2201 void emit_not(Register dst, int size);
2202 void emit_not(Operand dst, int size);
2203
2204 void emit_or(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2205 arithmetic_op(0x0B, dst, src, size);
2206 }
2207
2208 void emit_or(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2209 arithmetic_op(0x0B, dst, src, size);
2210 }
2211
2212 void emit_or(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2213 arithmetic_op(0x9, src, dst, size);
2214 }
2215
2216 void emit_or(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2217 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x1, dst, src, size);
2218 }
2219
2220 void emit_or(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2221 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x1, dst, src, size);
2222 }
2223
2224 void emit_repmovs(int size);
2225
2226 void emit_sbb(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2227 arithmetic_op(0x1b, dst, src, size);
2228 }
2229
2230 void emit_sub(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2231 arithmetic_op(0x2B, dst, src, size);
2232 }
2233
2234 void emit_sub(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2235 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x5, dst, src, size);
2236 }
2237
2238 void emit_sub(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2239 arithmetic_op(0x2B, dst, src, size);
2240 }
2241
2242 void emit_sub(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2243 arithmetic_op(0x29, src, dst, size);
2244 }
2245
2246 void emit_sub(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2247 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x5, dst, src, size);
2248 }
2249
2250 void emit_test(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2251 void emit_test(Register reg, Immediate mask, int size);
2252 void emit_test(Operand op, Register reg, int size);
2253 void emit_test(Operand op, Immediate mask, int size);
2254 void emit_test(Register reg, Operand op, int size) {
2255 return emit_test(op, reg, size);
2256 }
2257
2258 void emit_xchg(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2259 void emit_xchg(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2260
2261 void emit_xor(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2262 if (size == kInt64Size && dst.code() == src.code()) {
2263 // 32 bit operations zero the top 32 bits of 64 bit registers. Therefore
2264 // there is no need to make this a 64 bit operation.
2265 arithmetic_op(0x33, dst, src, kInt32Size);
2266 } else {
2267 arithmetic_op(0x33, dst, src, size);
2268 }
2269 }
2270
2271 void emit_xor(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2272 arithmetic_op(0x33, dst, src, size);
2273 }
2274
2275 void emit_xor(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2276 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x6, dst, src, size);
2277 }
2278
2279 void emit_xor(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2280 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x6, dst, src, size);
2281 }
2282
2283 void emit_xor(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2284 arithmetic_op(0x31, src, dst, size);
2285 }
2286
2287 // Most BMI instructions are similar.
2288 void bmi1q(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2289 void bmi1q(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2290 void bmi1l(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2291 void bmi1l(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2292 void bmi2q(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2293 void bmi2q(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2294 void bmi2l(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2295 void bmi2l(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2296
2297 // record the position of jmp/jcc instruction
2298 void record_farjmp_position(Label* L, int pos);
2299
2300 bool is_optimizable_farjmp(int idx);
2301
2302 void AllocateAndInstallRequestedHeapObjects(Isolate* isolate);
2303
2304 int WriteCodeComments();
2305
2306 friend class EnsureSpace;
2307 friend class RegExpMacroAssemblerX64;
2308
2309 // code generation
2310 RelocInfoWriter reloc_info_writer;
2311
2312 // Internal reference positions, required for (potential) patching in
2313 // GrowBuffer(); contains only those internal references whose labels
2314 // are already bound.
2315 std::deque<int> internal_reference_positions_;
2316
2317 // Variables for this instance of assembler
2318 int farjmp_num_ = 0;
2319 std::deque<int> farjmp_positions_;
2320 std::map<Label*, std::vector<int>> label_farjmp_maps_;
2321
2322 ConstPool constpool_;
2323
2324 friend class ConstPool;
2325
2326#if defined(V8_OS_WIN_X64)
2327 std::unique_ptr<win64_unwindinfo::XdataEncoder> xdata_encoder_;
2328#endif
2329};
2330
2331// Helper class that ensures that there is enough space for generating
2332// instructions and relocation information. The constructor makes
2333// sure that there is enough space and (in debug mode) the destructor
2334// checks that we did not generate too much.
2335class EnsureSpace {
2336 public:
2337 explicit EnsureSpace(Assembler* assembler) : assembler_(assembler) {
2338 if (assembler_->buffer_overflow()) assembler_->GrowBuffer();
2339#ifdef DEBUG
2340 space_before_ = assembler_->available_space();
2341#endif
2342 }
2343
2344#ifdef DEBUG
2345 ~EnsureSpace() {
2346 int bytes_generated = space_before_ - assembler_->available_space();
2347 DCHECK(bytes_generated < assembler_->kGap)((void) 0);
2348 }
2349#endif
2350
2351 private:
2352 Assembler* assembler_;
2353#ifdef DEBUG
2354 int space_before_;
2355#endif
2356};
2357
2358} // namespace internal
2359} // namespace v8

2361#endif // V8_CODEGEN_X64_ASSEMBLER_X64_H_

../deps/v8/src/compiler/backend/x64/code-generator-x64.cc

3// found in the LICENSE file.

5#include <limits>

7#include "src/base/overflowing-math.h"
8#include "src/codegen/macro-assembler.h"
9#include "src/codegen/optimized-compilation-info.h"
10#include "src/codegen/x64/assembler-x64.h"
11#include "src/compiler/backend/code-generator-impl.h"

13#include "src/compiler/backend/gap-resolver.h"

21namespace v8 {
22namespace internal {
23namespace compiler {
24
25#define __ tasm()->
26
27// Adds X64 specific methods for decoding operands.
28class X64OperandConverter : public InstructionOperandConverter {
29 public:
30 X64OperandConverter(CodeGenerator* gen, Instruction* instr)
31 : InstructionOperandConverter(gen, instr) {}
32
33 Immediate InputImmediate(size_t index) {
34 return ToImmediate(instr_->InputAt(index));
35 }
36
37 Operand InputOperand(size_t index, int extra = 0) {
38 return ToOperand(instr_->InputAt(index), extra);
39 }
40
41 Operand OutputOperand() { return ToOperand(instr_->Output()); }
42
43 Immediate ToImmediate(InstructionOperand* operand) {
44 Constant constant = ToConstant(operand);
45 if (constant.type() == Constant::kFloat64) {
46 DCHECK_EQ(0, constant.ToFloat64().AsUint64())((void) 0);
47 return Immediate(0);
48 }
49 if (RelocInfo::IsWasmReference(constant.rmode())) {
50 return Immediate(constant.ToInt32(), constant.rmode());
51 }
52 return Immediate(constant.ToInt32());
53 }
54
55 Operand ToOperand(InstructionOperand* op, int extra = 0) {
56 DCHECK(op->IsStackSlot() || op->IsFPStackSlot())((void) 0);
57 return SlotToOperand(AllocatedOperand::cast(op)->index(), extra);
5
←
Calling 'X64OperandConverter::SlotToOperand'
→
58 }
59
60 Operand SlotToOperand(int slot_index, int extra = 0) {
61 FrameOffset offset = frame_access_state()->GetFrameOffset(slot_index);
62 return Operand(offset.from_stack_pointer() ? rsp : rbp,
6
←
'?' condition is false
→
7
←
Calling constructor for 'Operand'
→
63 offset.offset() + extra);
64 }
65
66 static size_t NextOffset(size_t* offset) {
67 size_t i = *offset;
68 (*offset)++;
69 return i;
70 }
71
72 static ScaleFactor ScaleFor(AddressingMode one, AddressingMode mode) {
73 STATIC_ASSERT(0 == static_cast<int>(times_1))static_assert(0 == static_cast<int>(times_1), "0 == static_cast<int>(times_1)"
);
74 STATIC_ASSERT(1 == static_cast<int>(times_2))static_assert(1 == static_cast<int>(times_2), "1 == static_cast<int>(times_2)"
);
75 STATIC_ASSERT(2 == static_cast<int>(times_4))static_assert(2 == static_cast<int>(times_4), "2 == static_cast<int>(times_4)"
);
76 STATIC_ASSERT(3 == static_cast<int>(times_8))static_assert(3 == static_cast<int>(times_8), "3 == static_cast<int>(times_8)"
);
77 int scale = static_cast<int>(mode - one);
78 DCHECK(scale >= 0 && scale < 4)((void) 0);
79 return static_cast<ScaleFactor>(scale);
80 }
81
82 Operand MemoryOperand(size_t* offset) {
83 AddressingMode mode = AddressingModeField::decode(instr_->opcode());
84 switch (mode) {
85 case kMode_MR: {
86 Register base = InputRegister(NextOffset(offset));
87 int32_t disp = 0;
88 return Operand(base, disp);
89 }
90 case kMode_MRI: {
91 Register base = InputRegister(NextOffset(offset));
92 int32_t disp = InputInt32(NextOffset(offset));
93 return Operand(base, disp);
94 }
95 case kMode_MR1:
96 case kMode_MR2:
97 case kMode_MR4:
98 case kMode_MR8: {
99 Register base = InputRegister(NextOffset(offset));
100 Register index = InputRegister(NextOffset(offset));
101 ScaleFactor scale = ScaleFor(kMode_MR1, mode);
102 int32_t disp = 0;
103 return Operand(base, index, scale, disp);
104 }
105 case kMode_MR1I:
106 case kMode_MR2I:
107 case kMode_MR4I:
108 case kMode_MR8I: {
109 Register base = InputRegister(NextOffset(offset));
110 Register index = InputRegister(NextOffset(offset));
111 ScaleFactor scale = ScaleFor(kMode_MR1I, mode);
112 int32_t disp = InputInt32(NextOffset(offset));
113 return Operand(base, index, scale, disp);
114 }
115 case kMode_M1: {
116 Register base = InputRegister(NextOffset(offset));
117 int32_t disp = 0;
118 return Operand(base, disp);
119 }
120 case kMode_M2:
121 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code"); // Should use kModeMR with more compact encoding instead
122 return Operand(no_reg, 0);
123 case kMode_M4:
124 case kMode_M8: {
125 Register index = InputRegister(NextOffset(offset));
126 ScaleFactor scale = ScaleFor(kMode_M1, mode);
127 int32_t disp = 0;
128 return Operand(index, scale, disp);
129 }
130 case kMode_M1I:
131 case kMode_M2I:
132 case kMode_M4I:
133 case kMode_M8I: {
134 Register index = InputRegister(NextOffset(offset));
135 ScaleFactor scale = ScaleFor(kMode_M1I, mode);
136 int32_t disp = InputInt32(NextOffset(offset));
137 return Operand(index, scale, disp);
138 }
139 case kMode_Root: {
140 Register base = kRootRegister;
141 int32_t disp = InputInt32(NextOffset(offset));
142 return Operand(base, disp);
143 }
144 case kMode_None:
145 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
146 }
147 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
148 }
149
150 Operand MemoryOperand(size_t first_input = 0) {
151 return MemoryOperand(&first_input);
152 }
153};
154
155namespace {
156
157bool HasAddressingMode(Instruction* instr) {
158 return instr->addressing_mode() != kMode_None;
159}
160
161bool HasImmediateInput(Instruction* instr, size_t index) {
162 return instr->InputAt(index)->IsImmediate();
163}
164
165bool HasRegisterInput(Instruction* instr, size_t index) {
166 return instr->InputAt(index)->IsRegister();
167}
168
169class OutOfLineLoadFloat32NaN final : public OutOfLineCode {
170 public:
171 OutOfLineLoadFloat32NaN(CodeGenerator* gen, XMMRegister result)
172 : OutOfLineCode(gen), result_(result) {}
173
174 void Generate() final {
175 __ Xorps(result_, result_);
176 __ Divss(result_, result_);
177 }
178
179 private:
180 XMMRegister const result_;
181};
182
183class OutOfLineLoadFloat64NaN final : public OutOfLineCode {
184 public:
185 OutOfLineLoadFloat64NaN(CodeGenerator* gen, XMMRegister result)
186 : OutOfLineCode(gen), result_(result) {}
187
188 void Generate() final {
189 __ Xorpd(result_, result_);
190 __ Divsd(result_, result_);
191 }
192
193 private:
194 XMMRegister const result_;
195};
196
197class OutOfLineF32x4Min final : public OutOfLineCode {
198 public:
199 OutOfLineF32x4Min(CodeGenerator* gen, XMMRegister result, XMMRegister error)
200 : OutOfLineCode(gen), result_(result), error_(error) {}
201
202 void Generate() final {
203 // |result| is the partial result, |kScratchDoubleReg| is the error.
204 // propagate -0's and NaNs (possibly non-canonical) from the error.
205 __ Orps(error_, result_);
206 // Canonicalize NaNs by quieting and clearing the payload.
207 __ Cmpps(result_, error_, int8_t{3});
208 __ Orps(error_, result_);
209 __ Psrld(result_, byte{10});
210 __ Andnps(result_, error_);
211 }
212
213 private:
214 XMMRegister const result_;
215 XMMRegister const error_;
216};
217
218class OutOfLineF64x2Min final : public OutOfLineCode {
219 public:
220 OutOfLineF64x2Min(CodeGenerator* gen, XMMRegister result, XMMRegister error)
221 : OutOfLineCode(gen), result_(result), error_(error) {}
222
223 void Generate() final {
224 // |result| is the partial result, |kScratchDoubleReg| is the error.
225 // propagate -0's and NaNs (possibly non-canonical) from the error.
226 __ Orpd(error_, result_);
227 // Canonicalize NaNs by quieting and clearing the payload.
228 __ Cmppd(result_, error_, int8_t{3});
229 __ Orpd(error_, result_);
230 __ Psrlq(result_, 13);
231 __ Andnpd(result_, error_);
232 }
233
234 private:
235 XMMRegister const result_;
236 XMMRegister const error_;
237};
238
239class OutOfLineF32x4Max final : public OutOfLineCode {
240 public:
241 OutOfLineF32x4Max(CodeGenerator* gen, XMMRegister result, XMMRegister error)
242 : OutOfLineCode(gen), result_(result), error_(error) {}
243
244 void Generate() final {
245 // |result| is the partial result, |kScratchDoubleReg| is the error.
246 // Propagate NaNs (possibly non-canonical).
247 __ Orps(result_, error_);
248 // Propagate sign errors and (subtle) quiet NaNs.
249 __ Subps(result_, error_);
250 // Canonicalize NaNs by clearing the payload. Sign is non-deterministic.
251 __ Cmpps(error_, result_, int8_t{3});
252 __ Psrld(error_, byte{10});
253 __ Andnps(error_, result_);
254 __ Movaps(result_, error_);
255 }
256
257 private:
258 XMMRegister const result_;
259 XMMRegister const error_;
260};
261
262class OutOfLineF64x2Max final : public OutOfLineCode {
263 public:
264 OutOfLineF64x2Max(CodeGenerator* gen, XMMRegister result, XMMRegister error)
265 : OutOfLineCode(gen), result_(result), error_(error) {}
266
267 void Generate() final {
268 // |result| is the partial result, |kScratchDoubleReg| is the error.
269 // Propagate NaNs (possibly non-canonical).
270 __ Orpd(result_, error_);
271 // Propagate sign errors and (subtle) quiet NaNs.
272 __ Subpd(result_, error_);
273 // Canonicalize NaNs by clearing the payload. Sign is non-deterministic.
274 __ Cmppd(error_, result_, int8_t{3});
275 __ Psrlq(error_, byte{13});
276 __ Andnpd(error_, result_);
277 __ Movapd(result_, error_);
278 }
279
280 private:
281 XMMRegister const result_;
282 XMMRegister const error_;
283};
284
285class OutOfLineTruncateDoubleToI final : public OutOfLineCode {
286 public:
287 OutOfLineTruncateDoubleToI(CodeGenerator* gen, Register result,
288 XMMRegister input, StubCallMode stub_mode,
289 UnwindingInfoWriter* unwinding_info_writer)
290 : OutOfLineCode(gen),
291 result_(result),
292 input_(input),
293 stub_mode_(stub_mode),
294 unwinding_info_writer_(unwinding_info_writer),
295 isolate_(gen->isolate()),
296 zone_(gen->zone()) {}
297
298 void Generate() final {
299 __ AllocateStackSpace(kDoubleSize);
300 unwinding_info_writer_->MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
301 kDoubleSize);
302 __ Movsd(MemOperand(rsp, 0), input_);
303 if (stub_mode_ == StubCallMode::kCallWasmRuntimeStub) {
304 // A direct call to a wasm runtime stub defined in this module.
305 // Just encode the stub index. This will be patched when the code
306 // is added to the native module and copied into wasm code space.
307 __ near_call(wasm::WasmCode::kDoubleToI, RelocInfo::WASM_STUB_CALL);
308 } else if (tasm()->options().inline_offheap_trampolines) {
309 // With embedded builtins we do not need the isolate here. This allows
310 // the call to be generated asynchronously.
311 __ CallBuiltin(Builtins::kDoubleToI);
312 } else {
313 __ Call(BUILTIN_CODE(isolate_, DoubleToI)(isolate_)->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins::kDoubleToI
), RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
314 }
315 __ movl(result_, MemOperand(rsp, 0));
316 __ addq(rsp, Immediate(kDoubleSize));
317 unwinding_info_writer_->MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
318 -kDoubleSize);
319 }
320
321 private:
322 Register const result_;
323 XMMRegister const input_;
324 StubCallMode stub_mode_;
325 UnwindingInfoWriter* const unwinding_info_writer_;
326 Isolate* isolate_;
327 Zone* zone_;
328};
329
330class OutOfLineRecordWrite final : public OutOfLineCode {
331 public:
332 OutOfLineRecordWrite(CodeGenerator* gen, Register object, Operand operand,
333 Register value, Register scratch0, Register scratch1,
334 RecordWriteMode mode, StubCallMode stub_mode)
335 : OutOfLineCode(gen),
336 object_(object),
337 operand_(operand),
338 value_(value),
339 scratch0_(scratch0),
340 scratch1_(scratch1),
341 mode_(mode),
342 stub_mode_(stub_mode),
343 zone_(gen->zone()) {}
344
345 void Generate() final {
346 if (mode_ > RecordWriteMode::kValueIsPointer) {
347 __ JumpIfSmi(value_, exit());
348 }
349 if (COMPRESS_POINTERS_BOOLfalse) {
350 __ DecompressTaggedPointer(value_, value_);
351 }
352 __ CheckPageFlag(value_, scratch0_,
353 MemoryChunk::kPointersToHereAreInterestingMask, zero,
354 exit());
355 __ leaq(scratch1_, operand_);
356
357 RememberedSetAction const remembered_set_action =
358 mode_ > RecordWriteMode::kValueIsMap ? EMIT_REMEMBERED_SET
359 : OMIT_REMEMBERED_SET;
360 SaveFPRegsMode const save_fp_mode =
361 frame()->DidAllocateDoubleRegisters() ? kSaveFPRegs : kDontSaveFPRegs;
362
363 if (mode_ == RecordWriteMode::kValueIsEphemeronKey) {
364 __ CallEphemeronKeyBarrier(object_, scratch1_, save_fp_mode);
365 } else if (stub_mode_ == StubCallMode::kCallWasmRuntimeStub) {
366 // A direct call to a wasm runtime stub defined in this module.
367 // Just encode the stub index. This will be patched when the code
368 // is added to the native module and copied into wasm code space.
369 __ CallRecordWriteStub(object_, scratch1_, remembered_set_action,
370 save_fp_mode, wasm::WasmCode::kRecordWrite);
371 } else {
372 __ CallRecordWriteStub(object_, scratch1_, remembered_set_action,
373 save_fp_mode);
374 }
375 }
376
377 private:
378 Register const object_;
379 Operand const operand_;
380 Register const value_;
381 Register const scratch0_;
382 Register const scratch1_;
383 RecordWriteMode const mode_;
384 StubCallMode const stub_mode_;
385 Zone* zone_;
386};
387
388class WasmOutOfLineTrap : public OutOfLineCode {
389 public:
390 WasmOutOfLineTrap(CodeGenerator* gen, Instruction* instr)
391 : OutOfLineCode(gen), gen_(gen), instr_(instr) {}
392
393 void Generate() override {
394 X64OperandConverter i(gen_, instr_);
395 TrapId trap_id =
396 static_cast<TrapId>(i.InputInt32(instr_->InputCount() - 1));
397 GenerateWithTrapId(trap_id);
398 }
399
400 protected:
401 CodeGenerator* gen_;
402
403 void GenerateWithTrapId(TrapId trap_id) { GenerateCallToTrap(trap_id); }
404
405 private:
406 void GenerateCallToTrap(TrapId trap_id) {
407 if (!gen_->wasm_runtime_exception_support()) {
408 // We cannot test calls to the runtime in cctest/test-run-wasm.
409 // Therefore we emit a call to C here instead of a call to the runtime.
410 __ PrepareCallCFunction(0);
411 __ CallCFunction(ExternalReference::wasm_call_trap_callback_for_testing(),
412 0);
413 __ LeaveFrame(StackFrame::WASM);
414 auto call_descriptor = gen_->linkage()->GetIncomingDescriptor();
415 size_t pop_size =
416 call_descriptor->StackParameterCount() * kSystemPointerSize;
417 // Use rcx as a scratch register, we return anyways immediately.
418 __ Ret(static_cast<int>(pop_size), rcx);
419 } else {
420 gen_->AssembleSourcePosition(instr_);
421 // A direct call to a wasm runtime stub defined in this module.
422 // Just encode the stub index. This will be patched when the code
423 // is added to the native module and copied into wasm code space.
424 __ near_call(static_cast<Address>(trap_id), RelocInfo::WASM_STUB_CALL);
425 ReferenceMap* reference_map =
426 gen_->zone()->New<ReferenceMap>(gen_->zone());
427 gen_->RecordSafepoint(reference_map, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
428 __ AssertUnreachable(AbortReason::kUnexpectedReturnFromWasmTrap);
429 }
430 }
431
432 Instruction* instr_;
433};
434
435class WasmProtectedInstructionTrap final : public WasmOutOfLineTrap {
436 public:
437 WasmProtectedInstructionTrap(CodeGenerator* gen, int pc, Instruction* instr)
438 : WasmOutOfLineTrap(gen, instr), pc_(pc) {}
439
440 void Generate() final {
441 gen_->AddProtectedInstructionLanding(pc_, __ pc_offset());
442 GenerateWithTrapId(TrapId::kTrapMemOutOfBounds);
443 }
444
445 private:
446 int pc_;
447};
448
449void EmitOOLTrapIfNeeded(Zone* zone, CodeGenerator* codegen,
450 InstructionCode opcode, Instruction* instr,
451 int pc) {
452 const MemoryAccessMode access_mode =
453 static_cast<MemoryAccessMode>(MiscField::decode(opcode));
454 if (access_mode == kMemoryAccessProtected) {
455 zone->New<WasmProtectedInstructionTrap>(codegen, pc, instr);
456 }
457}
458
459void EmitWordLoadPoisoningIfNeeded(CodeGenerator* codegen,
460 InstructionCode opcode, Instruction* instr,
461 X64OperandConverter const& i) {
462 const MemoryAccessMode access_mode =
463 static_cast<MemoryAccessMode>(MiscField::decode(opcode));
464 if (access_mode == kMemoryAccessPoisoned) {
465 Register value = i.OutputRegister();
466 codegen->tasm()->andq(value, kSpeculationPoisonRegister);
467 }
468}
469
470} // namespace
471
472#define ASSEMBLE_UNOP(asm_instr) \
473 do { \
474 if (instr->Output()->IsRegister()) { \
475 __ asm_instr(i.OutputRegister()); \
476 } else { \
477 __ asm_instr(i.OutputOperand()); \
478 } \
479 } while (false)
480
481#define ASSEMBLE_BINOP(asm_instr) \
482 do { \
483 if (HasAddressingMode(instr)) { \
484 size_t index = 1; \
485 Operand right = i.MemoryOperand(&index); \
486 __ asm_instr(i.InputRegister(0), right); \
487 } else { \
488 if (HasImmediateInput(instr, 1)) { \
489 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 0)) { \
490 __ asm_instr(i.InputRegister(0), i.InputImmediate(1)); \
491 } else { \
492 __ asm_instr(i.InputOperand(0), i.InputImmediate(1)); \
493 } \
494 } else { \
495 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 1)) { \
496 __ asm_instr(i.InputRegister(0), i.InputRegister(1)); \
497 } else { \
498 __ asm_instr(i.InputRegister(0), i.InputOperand(1)); \
499 } \
500 } \
501 } \
502 } while (false)
503
504#define ASSEMBLE_COMPARE(asm_instr) \
505 do { \
506 if (HasAddressingMode(instr)) { \
507 size_t index = 0; \
508 Operand left = i.MemoryOperand(&index); \
509 if (HasImmediateInput(instr, index)) { \
510 __ asm_instr(left, i.InputImmediate(index)); \
511 } else { \
512 __ asm_instr(left, i.InputRegister(index)); \
513 } \
514 } else { \
515 if (HasImmediateInput(instr, 1)) { \
516 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 0)) { \
517 __ asm_instr(i.InputRegister(0), i.InputImmediate(1)); \
518 } else { \
519 __ asm_instr(i.InputOperand(0), i.InputImmediate(1)); \
520 } \
521 } else { \
522 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 1)) { \
523 __ asm_instr(i.InputRegister(0), i.InputRegister(1)); \
524 } else { \
525 __ asm_instr(i.InputRegister(0), i.InputOperand(1)); \
526 } \
527 } \
528 } \
529 } while (false)
530
531#define ASSEMBLE_MULT(asm_instr) \
532 do { \
533 if (HasImmediateInput(instr, 1)) { \
534 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 0)) { \
535 __ asm_instr(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputRegister(0), \
536 i.InputImmediate(1)); \
537 } else { \
538 __ asm_instr(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(0), \
539 i.InputImmediate(1)); \
540 } \
541 } else { \
542 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 1)) { \
543 __ asm_instr(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputRegister(1)); \
544 } else { \
545 __ asm_instr(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(1)); \
546 } \
547 } \
548 } while (false)
549
550#define ASSEMBLE_SHIFT(asm_instr, width) \
551 do { \
552 if (HasImmediateInput(instr, 1)) { \
553 if (instr->Output()->IsRegister()) { \
554 __ asm_instr(i.OutputRegister(), Immediate(i.InputInt##width(1))); \
555 } else { \
556 __ asm_instr(i.OutputOperand(), Immediate(i.InputInt##width(1))); \
557 } \
558 } else { \
559 if (instr->Output()->IsRegister()) { \
560 __ asm_instr##_cl(i.OutputRegister()); \
561 } else { \
562 __ asm_instr##_cl(i.OutputOperand()); \
563 } \
564 } \
565 } while (false)
566
567#define ASSEMBLE_MOVX(asm_instr) \
568 do { \
569 if (HasAddressingMode(instr)) { \
570 __ asm_instr(i.OutputRegister(), i.MemoryOperand()); \
571 } else if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 0)) { \
572 __ asm_instr(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputRegister(0)); \
573 } else { \
574 __ asm_instr(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(0)); \
575 } \
576 } while (false)
577
578#define ASSEMBLE_SSE_BINOP(asm_instr) \
579 do { \
580 if (instr->InputAt(1)->IsFPRegister()) { \
581 __ asm_instr(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputDoubleRegister(1)); \
582 } else { \
583 __ asm_instr(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputOperand(1)); \
584 } \
585 } while (false)
586
587#define ASSEMBLE_SSE_UNOP(asm_instr) \
588 do { \
589 if (instr->InputAt(0)->IsFPRegister()) { \
590 __ asm_instr(i.OutputDoubleRegister(), i.InputDoubleRegister(0)); \
591 } else { \
592 __ asm_instr(i.OutputDoubleRegister(), i.InputOperand(0)); \
593 } \
594 } while (false)
595
596#define ASSEMBLE_AVX_BINOP(asm_instr) \
597 do { \
598 CpuFeatureScope avx_scope(tasm(), AVX); \
599 if (instr->InputAt(1)->IsFPRegister()) { \
600 __ asm_instr(i.OutputDoubleRegister(), i.InputDoubleRegister(0), \
601 i.InputDoubleRegister(1)); \
602 } else { \
603 __ asm_instr(i.OutputDoubleRegister(), i.InputDoubleRegister(0), \
604 i.InputOperand(1)); \
605 } \
606 } while (false)
607
608#define ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_BINOP(name) \
609 do { \
610 __ PrepareCallCFunction(2); \
611 __ CallCFunction(ExternalReference::ieee754_##name##_function(), 2); \
612 } while (false)
613
614#define ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(name) \
615 do { \
616 __ PrepareCallCFunction(1); \
617 __ CallCFunction(ExternalReference::ieee754_##name##_function(), 1); \
618 } while (false)
619
620#define ASSEMBLE_ATOMIC_BINOP(bin_inst, mov_inst, cmpxchg_inst) \
621 do { \
622 Label binop; \
623 __ bind(&binop); \
624 __ mov_inst(rax, i.MemoryOperand(1)); \
625 __ movl(i.TempRegister(0), rax); \
626 __ bin_inst(i.TempRegister(0), i.InputRegister(0)); \
627 __ lock(); \
628 __ cmpxchg_inst(i.MemoryOperand(1), i.TempRegister(0)); \
629 __ j(not_equal, &binop); \
630 } while (false)
631
632#define ASSEMBLE_ATOMIC64_BINOP(bin_inst, mov_inst, cmpxchg_inst) \
633 do { \
634 Label binop; \
635 __ bind(&binop); \
636 __ mov_inst(rax, i.MemoryOperand(1)); \
637 __ movq(i.TempRegister(0), rax); \
638 __ bin_inst(i.TempRegister(0), i.InputRegister(0)); \
639 __ lock(); \
640 __ cmpxchg_inst(i.MemoryOperand(1), i.TempRegister(0)); \
641 __ j(not_equal, &binop); \
642 } while (false)
643
644#define ASSEMBLE_SIMD_INSTR(opcode, dst_operand, index) \
645 do { \
646 if (instr->InputAt(index)->IsSimd128Register()) { \
647 __ opcode(dst_operand, i.InputSimd128Register(index)); \
648 } else { \
649 __ opcode(dst_operand, i.InputOperand(index)); \
650 } \
651 } while (false)
652
653#define ASSEMBLE_SIMD_IMM_INSTR(opcode, dst_operand, index, imm) \
654 do { \
655 if (instr->InputAt(index)->IsSimd128Register()) { \
656 __ opcode(dst_operand, i.InputSimd128Register(index), imm); \
657 } else { \
658 __ opcode(dst_operand, i.InputOperand(index), imm); \
659 } \
660 } while (false)
661
662#define ASSEMBLE_SIMD_PUNPCK_SHUFFLE(opcode) \
663 do { \
664 XMMRegister dst = i.OutputSimd128Register(); \
665 DCHECK_EQ(dst, i.InputSimd128Register(0))((void) 0); \
666 byte input_index = instr->InputCount() == 2 ? 1 : 0; \
667 ASSEMBLE_SIMD_INSTR(opcode, dst, input_index); \
668 } while (false)
669
670#define ASSEMBLE_SIMD_IMM_SHUFFLE(opcode, imm) \
671 do { \
672 DCHECK_EQ(i.OutputSimd128Register(), i.InputSimd128Register(0))((void) 0); \
673 if (instr->InputAt(1)->IsSimd128Register()) { \
674 __ opcode(i.OutputSimd128Register(), i.InputSimd128Register(1), imm); \
675 } else { \
676 __ opcode(i.OutputSimd128Register(), i.InputOperand(1), imm); \
677 } \
678 } while (false)
679
680#define ASSEMBLE_SIMD_ALL_TRUE(opcode) \
681 do { \
682 Register dst = i.OutputRegister(); \
683 XMMRegister tmp = i.TempSimd128Register(0); \
684 __ xorq(dst, dst); \
685 __ Pxor(tmp, tmp); \
686 __ opcode(tmp, i.InputSimd128Register(0)); \
687 __ Ptest(tmp, tmp); \
688 __ setcc(equal, dst); \
689 } while (false)
690
691// This macro will directly emit the opcode if the shift is an immediate - the
692// shift value will be taken modulo 2^width. Otherwise, it will emit code to
693// perform the modulus operation.
694#define ASSEMBLE_SIMD_SHIFT(opcode, width) \
695 do { \
696 XMMRegister dst = i.OutputSimd128Register(); \
697 DCHECK_EQ(dst, i.InputSimd128Register(0))((void) 0); \
698 if (HasImmediateInput(instr, 1)) { \
699 __ opcode(dst, byte{i.InputInt##width(1)}); \
700 } else { \
701 XMMRegister tmp = i.TempSimd128Register(0); \
702 Register tmp_shift = i.TempRegister(1); \
703 constexpr int mask = (1 << width) - 1; \
704 __ movq(tmp_shift, i.InputRegister(1)); \
705 __ andq(tmp_shift, Immediate(mask)); \
706 __ Movq(tmp, tmp_shift); \
707 __ opcode(dst, tmp); \
708 } \
709 } while (false)
710
711void CodeGenerator::AssembleDeconstructFrame() {
712 unwinding_info_writer_.MarkFrameDeconstructed(__ pc_offset());
713 __ movq(rsp, rbp);
714 __ popq(rbp);
715}
716
717void CodeGenerator::AssemblePrepareTailCall() {
718 if (frame_access_state()->has_frame()) {
719 __ movq(rbp, MemOperand(rbp, 0));
720 }
721 frame_access_state()->SetFrameAccessToSP();
722}
723
724void CodeGenerator::AssemblePopArgumentsAdaptorFrame(Register args_reg,
725 Register scratch1,
726 Register scratch2,
727 Register scratch3) {
728 DCHECK(!AreAliased(args_reg, scratch1, scratch2, scratch3))((void) 0);
729 Label done;
730
731 // Check if current frame is an arguments adaptor frame.
732 __ cmpq(Operand(rbp, CommonFrameConstants::kContextOrFrameTypeOffset),
733 Immediate(StackFrame::TypeToMarker(StackFrame::ARGUMENTS_ADAPTOR)));
734 __ j(not_equal, &done, Label::kNear);
735
736 // Load arguments count from current arguments adaptor frame (note, it
737 // does not include receiver).
738 Register caller_args_count_reg = scratch1;
739 __ SmiUntag(caller_args_count_reg,
740 Operand(rbp, ArgumentsAdaptorFrameConstants::kLengthOffset));
741
742 __ PrepareForTailCall(args_reg, caller_args_count_reg, scratch2, scratch3);
743 __ bind(&done);
744}
745
746namespace {
747
748void AdjustStackPointerForTailCall(TurboAssembler* assembler,
749 FrameAccessState* state,
750 int new_slot_above_sp,
751 bool allow_shrinkage = true) {
752 int current_sp_offset = state->GetSPToFPSlotCount() +
753 StandardFrameConstants::kFixedSlotCountAboveFp;
754 int stack_slot_delta = new_slot_above_sp - current_sp_offset;
755 if (stack_slot_delta > 0) {
756 assembler->AllocateStackSpace(stack_slot_delta * kSystemPointerSize);
757 state->IncreaseSPDelta(stack_slot_delta);
758 } else if (allow_shrinkage && stack_slot_delta < 0) {
759 assembler->addq(rsp, Immediate(-stack_slot_delta * kSystemPointerSize));
760 state->IncreaseSPDelta(stack_slot_delta);
761 }
762}
763
764void SetupSimdImmediateInRegister(TurboAssembler* assembler, uint32_t* imms,
765 XMMRegister reg) {
766 assembler->Move(reg, make_uint64(imms[3], imms[2]),
767 make_uint64(imms[1], imms[0]));
768}
769
770} // namespace
771
772void CodeGenerator::AssembleTailCallBeforeGap(Instruction* instr,
773 int first_unused_stack_slot) {
774 CodeGenerator::PushTypeFlags flags(kImmediatePush | kScalarPush);
775 ZoneVector<MoveOperands*> pushes(zone());
776 GetPushCompatibleMoves(instr, flags, &pushes);
777
778 if (!pushes.empty() &&
779 (LocationOperand::cast(pushes.back()->destination()).index() + 1 ==
780 first_unused_stack_slot)) {
781 X64OperandConverter g(this, instr);
782 for (auto move : pushes) {
783 LocationOperand destination_location(
784 LocationOperand::cast(move->destination()));
785 InstructionOperand source(move->source());
786 AdjustStackPointerForTailCall(tasm(), frame_access_state(),
787 destination_location.index());
788 if (source.IsStackSlot()) {
789 LocationOperand source_location(LocationOperand::cast(source));
790 __ Push(g.SlotToOperand(source_location.index()));
791 } else if (source.IsRegister()) {
792 LocationOperand source_location(LocationOperand::cast(source));
793 __ Push(source_location.GetRegister());
794 } else if (source.IsImmediate()) {
795 __ Push(Immediate(ImmediateOperand::cast(source).inline_value()));
796 } else {
797 // Pushes of non-scalar data types is not supported.
798 UNIMPLEMENTED()V8_Fatal("unimplemented code");
799 }
800 frame_access_state()->IncreaseSPDelta(1);
801 move->Eliminate();
802 }
803 }
804 AdjustStackPointerForTailCall(tasm(), frame_access_state(),
805 first_unused_stack_slot, false);
806}
807
808void CodeGenerator::AssembleTailCallAfterGap(Instruction* instr,
809 int first_unused_stack_slot) {
810 AdjustStackPointerForTailCall(tasm(), frame_access_state(),
811 first_unused_stack_slot);
812}
813
814// Check that {kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister} is correct.
815void CodeGenerator::AssembleCodeStartRegisterCheck() {
816 __ ComputeCodeStartAddress(rbx);
817 __ cmpq(rbx, kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister);
818 __ Assert(equal, AbortReason::kWrongFunctionCodeStart);
819}
820
821// Check if the code object is marked for deoptimization. If it is, then it
822// jumps to the CompileLazyDeoptimizedCode builtin. In order to do this we need
823// to:
824// 1. read from memory the word that contains that bit, which can be found in
825// the flags in the referenced {CodeDataContainer} object;
826// 2. test kMarkedForDeoptimizationBit in those flags; and
827// 3. if it is not zero then it jumps to the builtin.
828void CodeGenerator::BailoutIfDeoptimized() {
829 int offset = Code::kCodeDataContainerOffset - Code::kHeaderSize;
830 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(rbx,
831 Operand(kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister, offset));
832 __ testl(FieldOperand(rbx, CodeDataContainer::kKindSpecificFlagsOffset),
833 Immediate(1 << Code::kMarkedForDeoptimizationBit));
834 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(isolate(), CompileLazyDeoptimizedCode)(isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins::kCompileLazyDeoptimizedCode
),
835 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET, not_zero);
836}
837
838void CodeGenerator::GenerateSpeculationPoisonFromCodeStartRegister() {
839 // Set a mask which has all bits set in the normal case, but has all
840 // bits cleared if we are speculatively executing the wrong PC.
841 __ ComputeCodeStartAddress(rbx);
842 __ xorq(kSpeculationPoisonRegister, kSpeculationPoisonRegister);
843 __ cmpq(kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister, rbx);
844 __ movq(rbx, Immediate(-1));
845 __ cmovq(equal, kSpeculationPoisonRegister, rbx);
846}
847
848void CodeGenerator::AssembleRegisterArgumentPoisoning() {
849 __ andq(kJSFunctionRegister, kSpeculationPoisonRegister);
850 __ andq(kContextRegister, kSpeculationPoisonRegister);
851 __ andq(rsp, kSpeculationPoisonRegister);
852}
853
854// Assembles an instruction after register allocation, producing machine code.
855CodeGenerator::CodeGenResult CodeGenerator::AssembleArchInstruction(
856 Instruction* instr) {
857 X64OperandConverter i(this, instr);
858 InstructionCode opcode = instr->opcode();
859 ArchOpcode arch_opcode = ArchOpcodeField::decode(opcode);
860 switch (arch_opcode) {
861 case kArchCallCodeObject: {
862 if (HasImmediateInput(instr, 0)) {
863 Handle<Code> code = i.InputCode(0);
864 __ Call(code, RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
865 } else {
866 Register reg = i.InputRegister(0);
867 DCHECK_IMPLIES(((void) 0)
868 HasCallDescriptorFlag(instr, CallDescriptor::kFixedTargetRegister),((void) 0)
869 reg == kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister)((void) 0);
870 __ LoadCodeObjectEntry(reg, reg);
871 if (HasCallDescriptorFlag(instr, CallDescriptor::kRetpoline)) {
872 __ RetpolineCall(reg);
873 } else {
874 __ call(reg);
875 }
876 }
877 RecordCallPosition(instr);
878 frame_access_state()->ClearSPDelta();
879 break;
880 }
881 case kArchCallBuiltinPointer: {
882 DCHECK(!HasImmediateInput(instr, 0))((void) 0);
883 Register builtin_index = i.InputRegister(0);
884 __ CallBuiltinByIndex(builtin_index);
885 RecordCallPosition(instr);
886 frame_access_state()->ClearSPDelta();
887 break;
888 }
889 case kArchCallWasmFunction: {
890 if (HasImmediateInput(instr, 0)) {
891 Constant constant = i.ToConstant(instr->InputAt(0));
892 Address wasm_code = static_cast<Address>(constant.ToInt64());
893 if (DetermineStubCallMode() == StubCallMode::kCallWasmRuntimeStub) {
894 __ near_call(wasm_code, constant.rmode());
895 } else {
896 if (HasCallDescriptorFlag(instr, CallDescriptor::kRetpoline)) {
897 __ RetpolineCall(wasm_code, constant.rmode());
898 } else {
899 __ Call(wasm_code, constant.rmode());
900 }
901 }
902 } else {
903 Register reg = i.InputRegister(0);
904 if (HasCallDescriptorFlag(instr, CallDescriptor::kRetpoline)) {
905 __ RetpolineCall(reg);
906 } else {
907 __ call(reg);
908 }
909 }
910 RecordCallPosition(instr);
911 frame_access_state()->ClearSPDelta();
912 break;
913 }
914 case kArchTailCallCodeObjectFromJSFunction:
915 case kArchTailCallCodeObject: {
916 if (arch_opcode == kArchTailCallCodeObjectFromJSFunction) {
917 AssemblePopArgumentsAdaptorFrame(kJavaScriptCallArgCountRegister,
918 i.TempRegister(0), i.TempRegister(1),
919 i.TempRegister(2));
920 }
921 if (HasImmediateInput(instr, 0)) {
922 Handle<Code> code = i.InputCode(0);
923 __ Jump(code, RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
924 } else {
925 Register reg = i.InputRegister(0);
926 DCHECK_IMPLIES(((void) 0)
927 HasCallDescriptorFlag(instr, CallDescriptor::kFixedTargetRegister),((void) 0)
928 reg == kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister)((void) 0);
929 __ LoadCodeObjectEntry(reg, reg);
930 if (HasCallDescriptorFlag(instr, CallDescriptor::kRetpoline)) {
931 __ RetpolineJump(reg);
932 } else {
933 __ jmp(reg);
934 }
935 }
936 unwinding_info_writer_.MarkBlockWillExit();
937 frame_access_state()->ClearSPDelta();
938 frame_access_state()->SetFrameAccessToDefault();
939 break;
940 }
941 case kArchTailCallWasm: {
942 if (HasImmediateInput(instr, 0)) {
943 Constant constant = i.ToConstant(instr->InputAt(0));
944 Address wasm_code = static_cast<Address>(constant.ToInt64());
945 if (DetermineStubCallMode() == StubCallMode::kCallWasmRuntimeStub) {
946 __ near_jmp(wasm_code, constant.rmode());
947 } else {
948 __ Move(kScratchRegister, wasm_code, constant.rmode());
949 __ jmp(kScratchRegister);
950 }
951 } else {
952 Register reg = i.InputRegister(0);
953 if (HasCallDescriptorFlag(instr, CallDescriptor::kRetpoline)) {
954 __ RetpolineJump(reg);
955 } else {
956 __ jmp(reg);
957 }
958 }
959 unwinding_info_writer_.MarkBlockWillExit();
960 frame_access_state()->ClearSPDelta();
961 frame_access_state()->SetFrameAccessToDefault();
962 break;
963 }
964 case kArchTailCallAddress: {
965 CHECK(!HasImmediateInput(instr, 0))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!HasImmediateInput(instr, 0))
), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "!HasImmediateInput(instr, 0)"
); } } while (false);
966 Register reg = i.InputRegister(0);
967 DCHECK_IMPLIES(((void) 0)
968 HasCallDescriptorFlag(instr, CallDescriptor::kFixedTargetRegister),((void) 0)
969 reg == kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister)((void) 0);
970 if (HasCallDescriptorFlag(instr, CallDescriptor::kRetpoline)) {
971 __ RetpolineJump(reg);
972 } else {
973 __ jmp(reg);
974 }
975 unwinding_info_writer_.MarkBlockWillExit();
976 frame_access_state()->ClearSPDelta();
977 frame_access_state()->SetFrameAccessToDefault();
978 break;
979 }
980 case kArchCallJSFunction: {
981 Register func = i.InputRegister(0);
982 if (FLAG_debug_code) {
983 // Check the function's context matches the context argument.
984 __ cmp_tagged(rsi, FieldOperand(func, JSFunction::kContextOffset));
985 __ Assert(equal, AbortReason::kWrongFunctionContext);
986 }
987 static_assert(kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister == rcx, "ABI mismatch");
988 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(rcx,
989 FieldOperand(func, JSFunction::kCodeOffset));
990 __ CallCodeObject(rcx);
991 frame_access_state()->ClearSPDelta();
992 RecordCallPosition(instr);
993 break;
994 }
995 case kArchPrepareCallCFunction: {
996 // Frame alignment requires using FP-relative frame addressing.
997 frame_access_state()->SetFrameAccessToFP();
998 int const num_parameters = MiscField::decode(instr->opcode());
999 __ PrepareCallCFunction(num_parameters);
1000 break;
1001 }
1002 case kArchSaveCallerRegisters: {
1003 fp_mode_ =
1004 static_cast<SaveFPRegsMode>(MiscField::decode(instr->opcode()));
1005 DCHECK(fp_mode_ == kDontSaveFPRegs || fp_mode_ == kSaveFPRegs)((void) 0);
1006 // kReturnRegister0 should have been saved before entering the stub.
1007 int bytes = __ PushCallerSaved(fp_mode_, kReturnRegister0);
1008 DCHECK(IsAligned(bytes, kSystemPointerSize))((void) 0);
1009 DCHECK_EQ(0, frame_access_state()->sp_delta())((void) 0);
1010 frame_access_state()->IncreaseSPDelta(bytes / kSystemPointerSize);
1011 DCHECK(!caller_registers_saved_)((void) 0);
1012 caller_registers_saved_ = true;
1013 break;
1014 }
1015 case kArchRestoreCallerRegisters: {
1016 DCHECK(fp_mode_ ==((void) 0)
1017 static_cast<SaveFPRegsMode>(MiscField::decode(instr->opcode())))((void) 0);
1018 DCHECK(fp_mode_ == kDontSaveFPRegs || fp_mode_ == kSaveFPRegs)((void) 0);
1019 // Don't overwrite the returned value.
1020 int bytes = __ PopCallerSaved(fp_mode_, kReturnRegister0);
1021 frame_access_state()->IncreaseSPDelta(-(bytes / kSystemPointerSize));
1022 DCHECK_EQ(0, frame_access_state()->sp_delta())((void) 0);
1023 DCHECK(caller_registers_saved_)((void) 0);
1024 caller_registers_saved_ = false;
1025 break;
1026 }
1027 case kArchPrepareTailCall:
1028 AssemblePrepareTailCall();
1029 break;
1030 case kArchCallCFunction: {
1031 int const num_parameters = MiscField::decode(instr->opcode());
1032 Label return_location;
1033 if (linkage()->GetIncomingDescriptor()->IsWasmCapiFunction()) {
1034 // Put the return address in a stack slot.
1035 __ leaq(kScratchRegister, Operand(&return_location, 0));
1036 __ movq(MemOperand(rbp, WasmExitFrameConstants::kCallingPCOffset),
1037 kScratchRegister);
1038 }
1039 if (HasImmediateInput(instr, 0)) {
1040 ExternalReference ref = i.InputExternalReference(0);
1041 __ CallCFunction(ref, num_parameters);
1042 } else {
1043 Register func = i.InputRegister(0);
1044 __ CallCFunction(func, num_parameters);
1045 }
1046 __ bind(&return_location);
1047 if (linkage()->GetIncomingDescriptor()->IsWasmCapiFunction()) {
1048 RecordSafepoint(instr->reference_map(), Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
1049 }
1050 frame_access_state()->SetFrameAccessToDefault();
1051 // Ideally, we should decrement SP delta to match the change of stack
1052 // pointer in CallCFunction. However, for certain architectures (e.g.
1053 // ARM), there may be more strict alignment requirement, causing old SP
1054 // to be saved on the stack. In those cases, we can not calculate the SP
1055 // delta statically.
1056 frame_access_state()->ClearSPDelta();
1057 if (caller_registers_saved_) {
1058 // Need to re-sync SP delta introduced in kArchSaveCallerRegisters.
1059 // Here, we assume the sequence to be:
1060 // kArchSaveCallerRegisters;
1061 // kArchCallCFunction;
1062 // kArchRestoreCallerRegisters;
1063 int bytes =
1064 __ RequiredStackSizeForCallerSaved(fp_mode_, kReturnRegister0);
1065 frame_access_state()->IncreaseSPDelta(bytes / kSystemPointerSize);
1066 }
1067 // TODO(tebbi): Do we need an lfence here?
1068 break;
1069 }
1070 case kArchJmp:
1071 AssembleArchJump(i.InputRpo(0));
1072 break;
1073 case kArchBinarySearchSwitch:
1074 AssembleArchBinarySearchSwitch(instr);
1075 break;
1076 case kArchTableSwitch:
1077 AssembleArchTableSwitch(instr);
1078 break;
1079 case kArchComment:
1080 __ RecordComment(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(i.InputInt64(0)));
1081 break;
1082 case kArchAbortCSAAssert:
1083 DCHECK(i.InputRegister(0) == rdx)((void) 0);
1084 {
1085 // We don't actually want to generate a pile of code for this, so just
1086 // claim there is a stack frame, without generating one.
1087 FrameScope scope(tasm(), StackFrame::NONE);
1088 __ Call(
1089 isolate()->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins::kAbortCSAAssert),
1090 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
1091 }
1092 __ int3();
1093 unwinding_info_writer_.MarkBlockWillExit();
1094 break;
1095 case kArchDebugBreak:
1096 __ DebugBreak();
1097 break;
1098 case kArchThrowTerminator:
1099 unwinding_info_writer_.MarkBlockWillExit();
1100 break;
1101 case kArchNop:
1102 // don't emit code for nops.
1103 break;
1104 case kArchDeoptimize: {
1105 DeoptimizationExit* exit =
1106 BuildTranslation(instr, -1, 0, OutputFrameStateCombine::Ignore());
1107 CodeGenResult result = AssembleDeoptimizerCall(exit);
1108 if (result != kSuccess) return result;
1109 unwinding_info_writer_.MarkBlockWillExit();
1110 break;
1111 }
1112 case kArchRet:
1113 AssembleReturn(instr->InputAt(0));
1114 break;
1115 case kArchFramePointer:
1116 __ movq(i.OutputRegister(), rbp);
1117 break;
1118 case kArchParentFramePointer:
1119 if (frame_access_state()->has_frame()) {
1120 __ movq(i.OutputRegister(), Operand(rbp, 0));
1121 } else {
1122 __ movq(i.OutputRegister(), rbp);
1123 }
1124 break;
1125 case kArchStackPointerGreaterThan: {
1126 // Potentially apply an offset to the current stack pointer before the
1127 // comparison to consider the size difference of an optimized frame versus
1128 // the contained unoptimized frames.
1129
1130 Register lhs_register = rsp;
1131 uint32_t offset;
1132
1133 if (ShouldApplyOffsetToStackCheck(instr, &offset)) {
1134 lhs_register = kScratchRegister;
1135 __ leaq(lhs_register, Operand(rsp, static_cast<int32_t>(offset) * -1));
1136 }
1137
1138 constexpr size_t kValueIndex = 0;
1139 if (HasAddressingMode(instr)) {
1140 __ cmpq(lhs_register, i.MemoryOperand(kValueIndex));
1141 } else {
1142 __ cmpq(lhs_register, i.InputRegister(kValueIndex));
1143 }
1144 break;
1145 }
1146 case kArchStackCheckOffset:
1147 __ Move(i.OutputRegister(), Smi::FromInt(GetStackCheckOffset()));
1148 break;
1149 case kArchTruncateDoubleToI: {
1150 auto result = i.OutputRegister();
1151 auto input = i.InputDoubleRegister(0);
1152 auto ool = zone()->New<OutOfLineTruncateDoubleToI>(
1153 this, result, input, DetermineStubCallMode(),
1154 &unwinding_info_writer_);
1155 // We use Cvttsd2siq instead of Cvttsd2si due to performance reasons. The
1156 // use of Cvttsd2siq requires the movl below to avoid sign extension.
1157 __ Cvttsd2siq(result, input);
1158 __ cmpq(result, Immediate(1));
1159 __ j(overflow, ool->entry());
1160 __ bind(ool->exit());
1161 __ movl(result, result);
1162 break;
1163 }
1164 case kArchStoreWithWriteBarrier: {
1165 RecordWriteMode mode =
1166 static_cast<RecordWriteMode>(MiscField::decode(instr->opcode()));
1167 Register object = i.InputRegister(0);
1168 size_t index = 0;
1169 Operand operand = i.MemoryOperand(&index);
1170 Register value = i.InputRegister(index);
1171 Register scratch0 = i.TempRegister(0);
1172 Register scratch1 = i.TempRegister(1);
1173 auto ool = zone()->New<OutOfLineRecordWrite>(this, object, operand, value,
1174 scratch0, scratch1, mode,
1175 DetermineStubCallMode());
1176 __ StoreTaggedField(operand, value);
1177 __ CheckPageFlag(object, scratch0,
1178 MemoryChunk::kPointersFromHereAreInterestingMask,
1179 not_zero, ool->entry());
1180 __ bind(ool->exit());
1181 break;
1182 }
1183 case kArchWordPoisonOnSpeculation:
1184 DCHECK_EQ(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputRegister(0))((void) 0);
1185 __ andq(i.InputRegister(0), kSpeculationPoisonRegister);
1186 break;
1187 case kX64MFence:
1188 __ mfence();
1189 break;
1190 case kX64LFence:
1191 __ lfence();
1192 break;
1193 case kArchStackSlot: {
1194 FrameOffset offset =
1195 frame_access_state()->GetFrameOffset(i.InputInt32(0));
1196 Register base = offset.from_stack_pointer() ? rsp : rbp;
1197 __ leaq(i.OutputRegister(), Operand(base, offset.offset()));
1198 break;
1199 }
1200 case kIeee754Float64Acos:
1201 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(acos);
1202 break;
1203 case kIeee754Float64Acosh:
1204 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(acosh);
1205 break;
1206 case kIeee754Float64Asin:
1207 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(asin);
1208 break;
1209 case kIeee754Float64Asinh:
1210 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(asinh);
1211 break;
1212 case kIeee754Float64Atan:
1213 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(atan);
1214 break;
1215 case kIeee754Float64Atanh:
1216 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(atanh);
1217 break;
1218 case kIeee754Float64Atan2:
1219 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_BINOP(atan2);
1220 break;
1221 case kIeee754Float64Cbrt:
1222 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(cbrt);
1223 break;
1224 case kIeee754Float64Cos:
1225 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(cos);
1226 break;
1227 case kIeee754Float64Cosh:
1228 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(cosh);
1229 break;
1230 case kIeee754Float64Exp:
1231 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(exp);
1232 break;
1233 case kIeee754Float64Expm1:
1234 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(expm1);
1235 break;
1236 case kIeee754Float64Log:
1237 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(log);
1238 break;
1239 case kIeee754Float64Log1p:
1240 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(log1p);
1241 break;
1242 case kIeee754Float64Log2:
1243 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(log2);
1244 break;
1245 case kIeee754Float64Log10:
1246 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(log10);
1247 break;
1248 case kIeee754Float64Pow:
1249 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_BINOP(pow);
1250 break;
1251 case kIeee754Float64Sin:
1252 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(sin);
1253 break;
1254 case kIeee754Float64Sinh:
1255 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(sinh);
1256 break;
1257 case kIeee754Float64Tan:
1258 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(tan);
1259 break;
1260 case kIeee754Float64Tanh:
1261 ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP(tanh);
1262 break;
1263 case kX64Add32:
1264 ASSEMBLE_BINOP(addl);
1265 break;
1266 case kX64Add:
1267 ASSEMBLE_BINOP(addq);
1268 break;
1269 case kX64Sub32:
1270 ASSEMBLE_BINOP(subl);
1271 break;
1272 case kX64Sub:
1273 ASSEMBLE_BINOP(subq);
1274 break;
1275 case kX64And32:
1276 ASSEMBLE_BINOP(andl);
1277 break;
1278 case kX64And:
1279 ASSEMBLE_BINOP(andq);
1280 break;
1281 case kX64Cmp8:
1282 ASSEMBLE_COMPARE(cmpb);
1283 break;
1284 case kX64Cmp16:
1285 ASSEMBLE_COMPARE(cmpw);
1286 break;
1287 case kX64Cmp32:
1288 ASSEMBLE_COMPARE(cmpl);
1289 break;
1290 case kX64Cmp:
1291 ASSEMBLE_COMPARE(cmpq);
1292 break;
1293 case kX64Test8:
1294 ASSEMBLE_COMPARE(testb);
1295 break;
1296 case kX64Test16:
1297 ASSEMBLE_COMPARE(testw);
1298 break;
1299 case kX64Test32:
1300 ASSEMBLE_COMPARE(testl);
1301 break;
1302 case kX64Test:
1303 ASSEMBLE_COMPARE(testq);
1304 break;
1305 case kX64Imul32:
1306 ASSEMBLE_MULT(imull);
1307 break;
1308 case kX64Imul:
1309 ASSEMBLE_MULT(imulq);
1310 break;
1311 case kX64ImulHigh32:
1312 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 1)) {
1313 __ imull(i.InputRegister(1));
1314 } else {
1315 __ imull(i.InputOperand(1));
1316 }
1317 break;
1318 case kX64UmulHigh32:
1319 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 1)) {
1320 __ mull(i.InputRegister(1));
1321 } else {
1322 __ mull(i.InputOperand(1));
1323 }
1324 break;
1325 case kX64Idiv32:
1326 __ cdq();
1327 __ idivl(i.InputRegister(1));
1328 break;
1329 case kX64Idiv:
1330 __ cqo();
1331 __ idivq(i.InputRegister(1));
1332 break;
1333 case kX64Udiv32:
1334 __ xorl(rdx, rdx);
1335 __ divl(i.InputRegister(1));
1336 break;
1337 case kX64Udiv:
1338 __ xorq(rdx, rdx);
1339 __ divq(i.InputRegister(1));
1340 break;
1341 case kX64Not:
1342 ASSEMBLE_UNOP(notq);
1343 break;
1344 case kX64Not32:
1345 ASSEMBLE_UNOP(notl);
1346 break;
1347 case kX64Neg:
1348 ASSEMBLE_UNOP(negq);
1349 break;
1350 case kX64Neg32:
1351 ASSEMBLE_UNOP(negl);
1352 break;
1353 case kX64Or32:
1354 ASSEMBLE_BINOP(orl);
1355 break;
1356 case kX64Or:
1357 ASSEMBLE_BINOP(orq);
1358 break;
1359 case kX64Xor32:
1360 ASSEMBLE_BINOP(xorl);
1361 break;
1362 case kX64Xor:
1363 ASSEMBLE_BINOP(xorq);
1364 break;
1365 case kX64Shl32:
1366 ASSEMBLE_SHIFT(shll, 5);
1367 break;
1368 case kX64Shl:
1369 ASSEMBLE_SHIFT(shlq, 6);
1370 break;
1371 case kX64Shr32:
1372 ASSEMBLE_SHIFT(shrl, 5);
1373 break;
1374 case kX64Shr:
1375 ASSEMBLE_SHIFT(shrq, 6);
1376 break;
1377 case kX64Sar32:
1378 ASSEMBLE_SHIFT(sarl, 5);
1379 break;
1380 case kX64Sar:
1381 ASSEMBLE_SHIFT(sarq, 6);
1382 break;
1383 case kX64Rol32:
1384 ASSEMBLE_SHIFT(roll, 5);
1385 break;
1386 case kX64Rol:
1387 ASSEMBLE_SHIFT(rolq, 6);
1388 break;
1389 case kX64Ror32:
1390 ASSEMBLE_SHIFT(rorl, 5);
1391 break;
1392 case kX64Ror:
1393 ASSEMBLE_SHIFT(rorq, 6);
1394 break;
1395 case kX64Lzcnt:
1396 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 0)) {
1397 __ Lzcntq(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputRegister(0));
1398 } else {
1399 __ Lzcntq(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(0));
1400 }
1401 break;
1402 case kX64Lzcnt32:
1403 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 0)) {
1404 __ Lzcntl(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputRegister(0));
1405 } else {
1406 __ Lzcntl(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(0));
1407 }
1408 break;
1409 case kX64Tzcnt:
1410 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 0)) {
1411 __ Tzcntq(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputRegister(0));
1412 } else {
1413 __ Tzcntq(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(0));
1414 }
1415 break;
1416 case kX64Tzcnt32:
1417 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 0)) {
1418 __ Tzcntl(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputRegister(0));
1419 } else {
1420 __ Tzcntl(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(0));
1421 }
1422 break;
1423 case kX64Popcnt:
1424 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 0)) {
1425 __ Popcntq(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputRegister(0));
1426 } else {
1427 __ Popcntq(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(0));
1428 }
1429 break;
1430 case kX64Popcnt32:
1431 if (HasRegisterInput(instr, 0)) {
1432 __ Popcntl(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputRegister(0));
1433 } else {
1434 __ Popcntl(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(0));
1435 }
1436 break;
1437 case kX64Bswap:
1438 __ bswapq(i.OutputRegister());
1439 break;
1440 case kX64Bswap32:
1441 __ bswapl(i.OutputRegister());
1442 break;
1443 case kSSEFloat32Cmp:
1444 ASSEMBLE_SSE_BINOP(Ucomiss);
1445 break;
1446 case kSSEFloat32Add:
1447 ASSEMBLE_SSE_BINOP(addss);
1448 break;
1449 case kSSEFloat32Sub:
1450 ASSEMBLE_SSE_BINOP(subss);
1451 break;
1452 case kSSEFloat32Mul:
1453 ASSEMBLE_SSE_BINOP(mulss);
1454 break;
1455 case kSSEFloat32Div:
1456 ASSEMBLE_SSE_BINOP(divss);
1457 // Don't delete this mov. It may improve performance on some CPUs,
1458 // when there is a (v)mulss depending on the result.
1459 __ movaps(i.OutputDoubleRegister(), i.OutputDoubleRegister());
1460 break;
1461 case kSSEFloat32Abs: {
1462 // TODO(bmeurer): Use RIP relative 128-bit constants.
1463 XMMRegister tmp = i.ToDoubleRegister(instr->TempAt(0));
1464 __ Pcmpeqd(tmp, tmp);
1465 __ Psrlq(tmp, 33);
1466 __ Andps(i.OutputDoubleRegister(), tmp);
1467 break;
1468 }
1469 case kSSEFloat32Neg: {
1470 // TODO(bmeurer): Use RIP relative 128-bit constants.
1471 XMMRegister tmp = i.ToDoubleRegister(instr->TempAt(0));
1472 __ Pcmpeqd(tmp, tmp);
1473 __ Psllq(tmp, 31);
1474 __ Xorps(i.OutputDoubleRegister(), tmp);
1475 break;
1476 }
1477 case kSSEFloat32Sqrt:
1478 ASSEMBLE_SSE_UNOP(sqrtss);
1479 break;
1480 case kSSEFloat32ToFloat64:
1481 ASSEMBLE_SSE_UNOP(Cvtss2sd);
1482 break;
1483 case kSSEFloat32Round: {
1484 CpuFeatureScope sse_scope(tasm(), SSE4_1);
1485 RoundingMode const mode =
1486 static_cast<RoundingMode>(MiscField::decode(instr->opcode()));
1487 __ Roundss(i.OutputDoubleRegister(), i.InputDoubleRegister(0), mode);
1488 break;
1489 }
1490 case kSSEFloat32ToInt32:
1491 if (instr->InputAt(0)->IsFPRegister()) {
1492 __ Cvttss2si(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputDoubleRegister(0));
1493 } else {
1494 __ Cvttss2si(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(0));
1495 }
1496 break;
1497 case kSSEFloat32ToUint32: {
1498 if (instr->InputAt(0)->IsFPRegister()) {
1499 __ Cvttss2siq(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputDoubleRegister(0));
1500 } else {
1501 __ Cvttss2siq(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(0));
1502 }
1503 break;
1504 }
1505 case kSSEFloat64Cmp:
1506 ASSEMBLE_SSE_BINOP(Ucomisd);
1507 break;
1508 case kSSEFloat64Add:
1509 ASSEMBLE_SSE_BINOP(addsd);
1510 break;
1511 case kSSEFloat64Sub:
1512 ASSEMBLE_SSE_BINOP(subsd);
1513 break;
1514 case kSSEFloat64Mul:
1515 ASSEMBLE_SSE_BINOP(mulsd);
1516 break;
1517 case kSSEFloat64Div:
1518 ASSEMBLE_SSE_BINOP(divsd);
1519 // Don't delete this mov. It may improve performance on some CPUs,
1520 // when there is a (v)mulsd depending on the result.
1521 __ Movapd(i.OutputDoubleRegister(), i.OutputDoubleRegister());
1522 break;
1523 case kSSEFloat64Mod: {
1524 __ AllocateStackSpace(kDoubleSize);
1525 unwinding_info_writer_.MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
1526 kDoubleSize);
1527 // Move values to st(0) and st(1).
1528 __ Movsd(Operand(rsp, 0), i.InputDoubleRegister(1));
1529 __ fld_d(Operand(rsp, 0));
1530 __ Movsd(Operand(rsp, 0), i.InputDoubleRegister(0));
1531 __ fld_d(Operand(rsp, 0));
1532 // Loop while fprem isn't done.
1533 Label mod_loop;
1534 __ bind(&mod_loop);
1535 // This instructions traps on all kinds inputs, but we are assuming the
1536 // floating point control word is set to ignore them all.
1537 __ fprem();
1538 // The following 2 instruction implicitly use rax.
1539 __ fnstsw_ax();
1540 if (CpuFeatures::IsSupported(SAHF)) {
1541 CpuFeatureScope sahf_scope(tasm(), SAHF);
1542 __ sahf();
1543 } else {
1544 __ shrl(rax, Immediate(8));
1545 __ andl(rax, Immediate(0xFF));
1546 __ pushq(rax);
1547 unwinding_info_writer_.MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
1548 kSystemPointerSize);
1549 __ popfq();
1550 unwinding_info_writer_.MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
1551 -kSystemPointerSize);
1552 }
1553 __ j(parity_even, &mod_loop);
1554 // Move output to stack and clean up.
1555 __ fstp(1);
1556 __ fstp_d(Operand(rsp, 0));
1557 __ Movsd(i.OutputDoubleRegister(), Operand(rsp, 0));
1558 __ addq(rsp, Immediate(kDoubleSize));
1559 unwinding_info_writer_.MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
1560 -kDoubleSize);
1561 break;
1562 }
1563 case kSSEFloat32Max: {
1564 Label compare_swap, done_compare;
1565 if (instr->InputAt(1)->IsFPRegister()) {
1566 __ Ucomiss(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputDoubleRegister(1));
1567 } else {
1568 __ Ucomiss(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputOperand(1));
1569 }
1570 auto ool =
1571 zone()->New<OutOfLineLoadFloat32NaN>(this, i.OutputDoubleRegister());
1572 __ j(parity_even, ool->entry());
1573 __ j(above, &done_compare, Label::kNear);
1574 __ j(below, &compare_swap, Label::kNear);
1575 __ Movmskps(kScratchRegister, i.InputDoubleRegister(0));
1576 __ testl(kScratchRegister, Immediate(1));
1577 __ j(zero, &done_compare, Label::kNear);
1578 __ bind(&compare_swap);
1579 if (instr->InputAt(1)->IsFPRegister()) {
1580 __ Movss(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputDoubleRegister(1));
1581 } else {
1582 __ Movss(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputOperand(1));
1583 }
1584 __ bind(&done_compare);
1585 __ bind(ool->exit());
1586 break;
1587 }
1588 case kSSEFloat32Min: {
1589 Label compare_swap, done_compare;
1590 if (instr->InputAt(1)->IsFPRegister()) {
1591 __ Ucomiss(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputDoubleRegister(1));
1592 } else {
1593 __ Ucomiss(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputOperand(1));
1594 }
1595 auto ool =
1596 zone()->New<OutOfLineLoadFloat32NaN>(this, i.OutputDoubleRegister());
1597 __ j(parity_even, ool->entry());
1598 __ j(below, &done_compare, Label::kNear);
1599 __ j(above, &compare_swap, Label::kNear);
1600 if (instr->InputAt(1)->IsFPRegister()) {
1601 __ Movmskps(kScratchRegister, i.InputDoubleRegister(1));
1602 } else {
1603 __ Movss(kScratchDoubleReg, i.InputOperand(1));
1604 __ Movmskps(kScratchRegister, kScratchDoubleReg);
1605 }
1606 __ testl(kScratchRegister, Immediate(1));
1607 __ j(zero, &done_compare, Label::kNear);
1608 __ bind(&compare_swap);
1609 if (instr->InputAt(1)->IsFPRegister()) {
1610 __ Movss(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputDoubleRegister(1));
1611 } else {
1612 __ Movss(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputOperand(1));
1613 }
1614 __ bind(&done_compare);
1615 __ bind(ool->exit());
1616 break;
1617 }
1618 case kSSEFloat64Max: {
1619 Label compare_swap, done_compare;
1620 if (instr->InputAt(1)->IsFPRegister()) {
1621 __ Ucomisd(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputDoubleRegister(1));
1622 } else {
1623 __ Ucomisd(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputOperand(1));
1624 }
1625 auto ool =
1626 zone()->New<OutOfLineLoadFloat64NaN>(this, i.OutputDoubleRegister());
1627 __ j(parity_even, ool->entry());
1628 __ j(above, &done_compare, Label::kNear);
1629 __ j(below, &compare_swap, Label::kNear);
1630 __ Movmskpd(kScratchRegister, i.InputDoubleRegister(0));
1631 __ testl(kScratchRegister, Immediate(1));
1632 __ j(zero, &done_compare, Label::kNear);
1633 __ bind(&compare_swap);
1634 if (instr->InputAt(1)->IsFPRegister()) {
1635 __ Movsd(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputDoubleRegister(1));
1636 } else {
1637 __ Movsd(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputOperand(1));
1638 }
1639 __ bind(&done_compare);
1640 __ bind(ool->exit());
1641 break;
1642 }
1643 case kSSEFloat64Min: {
1644 Label compare_swap, done_compare;
1645 if (instr->InputAt(1)->IsFPRegister()) {
1646 __ Ucomisd(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputDoubleRegister(1));
1647 } else {
1648 __ Ucomisd(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputOperand(1));
1649 }
1650 auto ool =
1651 zone()->New<OutOfLineLoadFloat64NaN>(this, i.OutputDoubleRegister());
1652 __ j(parity_even, ool->entry());
1653 __ j(below, &done_compare, Label::kNear);
1654 __ j(above, &compare_swap, Label::kNear);
1655 if (instr->InputAt(1)->IsFPRegister()) {
1656 __ Movmskpd(kScratchRegister, i.InputDoubleRegister(1));
1657 } else {
1658 __ Movsd(kScratchDoubleReg, i.InputOperand(1));
1659 __ Movmskpd(kScratchRegister, kScratchDoubleReg);
1660 }
1661 __ testl(kScratchRegister, Immediate(1));
1662 __ j(zero, &done_compare, Label::kNear);
1663 __ bind(&compare_swap);
1664 if (instr->InputAt(1)->IsFPRegister()) {
1665 __ Movsd(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputDoubleRegister(1));
1666 } else {
1667 __ Movsd(i.InputDoubleRegister(0), i.InputOperand(1));
1668 }
1669 __ bind(&done_compare);
1670 __ bind(ool->exit());
1671 break;
1672 }
1673 case kX64F64x2Abs:
1674 case kSSEFloat64Abs: {
1675 // TODO(bmeurer): Use RIP relative 128-bit constants.
1676 XMMRegister tmp = i.ToDoubleRegister(instr->TempAt(0));
1677 __ Pcmpeqd(tmp, tmp);
1678 __ Psrlq(tmp, 1);
1679 __ Andpd(i.OutputDoubleRegister(), tmp);
1680 break;
1681 }
1682 case kX64F64x2Neg:
1683 case kSSEFloat64Neg: {
1684 // TODO(bmeurer): Use RIP relative 128-bit constants.
1685 XMMRegister tmp = i.ToDoubleRegister(instr->TempAt(0));
1686 __ Pcmpeqd(tmp, tmp);
1687 __ Psllq(tmp, 63);
1688 __ Xorpd(i.OutputDoubleRegister(), tmp);
1689 break;
1690 }
1691 case kSSEFloat64Sqrt:
1692 ASSEMBLE_SSE_UNOP(Sqrtsd);
1693 break;
1694 case kSSEFloat64Round: {
1695 CpuFeatureScope sse_scope(tasm(), SSE4_1);
1696 RoundingMode const mode =
1697 static_cast<RoundingMode>(MiscField::decode(instr->opcode()));
1698 __ Roundsd(i.OutputDoubleRegister(), i.InputDoubleRegister(0), mode);
1699 break;
1700 }
1701 case kSSEFloat64ToFloat32:
1702 ASSEMBLE_SSE_UNOP(Cvtsd2ss);
1703 break;
1704 case kSSEFloat64ToInt32:
1705 if (instr->InputAt(0)->IsFPRegister()) {
1706 __ Cvttsd2si(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputDoubleRegister(0));
1707 } else {
1708 __ Cvttsd2si(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(0));
1709 }
1710 break;
1711 case kSSEFloat64ToUint32: {
1712 if (instr->InputAt(0)->IsFPRegister()) {
1713 __ Cvttsd2siq(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputDoubleRegister(0));
1714 } else {
1715 __ Cvttsd2siq(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(0));
1716 }
1717 if (MiscField::decode(instr->opcode())) {
1718 __ AssertZeroExtended(i.OutputRegister());
1719 }
1720 break;
1721 }
1722 case kSSEFloat32ToInt64:
1723 if (instr->InputAt(0)->IsFPRegister()) {
1724 __ Cvttss2siq(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputDoubleRegister(0));
1725 } else {
1726 __ Cvttss2siq(i.OutputRegister(), i.InputOperand(0));
1727 }
1728 if (instr->OutputCount() > 1) {
1729 __ Set(i.OutputRegister(1), 1);
1730 Label done;
1731 Label fail;
1732 __ Move(kScratchDoubleReg, static_cast<float>(INT64_MIN(-9223372036854775807L -1)));
1733 if (instr->InputAt(0)->IsFPRegister()) {
1734 __ Ucomiss(kScratchDoubleReg, i.InputDoubleRegister(0));
1735 } else {
1736 __ Ucomiss(kScratchDoubleReg, i.InputOperand(0));
1737 }
1738 // If the input is NaN, then the conversion fails.
1739 __ j(parity_even, &fail, Label::kNear);
1740 // If the input is INT64_MIN, then the conversion succeeds.
1741 __ j(equal, &done, Label::kNear);
1742 __ cmpq(i.OutputRegister(0), Immediate(1));
1743 // If the conversion results in INT64_MIN, but the input was not
1744 // INT64_MIN, then the conversion fails.
