4051 __ Psrlw(kScratchDoubleReg, byte{8});
4052 __ Psllw(dst, byte{8});
4053 __ Por(dst, kScratchDoubleReg);
4054 break;
4055 }
4056 case kX64V64x2AnyTrue:
4057 case kX64V32x4AnyTrue:
4058 case kX64V16x8AnyTrue:
4059 case kX64V8x16AnyTrue: {
4060 Register dst = i.OutputRegister();
4061 XMMRegister src = i.InputSimd128Register(0);
4062
4063 __ xorq(dst, dst);
4064 __ Ptest(src, src);
4065 __ setcc(not_equal, dst);
4066 break;
4067 }
4068 // Need to split up all the different lane structures because the
4069 // comparison instruction used matters, e.g. given 0xff00, pcmpeqb returns
4070 // 0x0011, pcmpeqw returns 0x0000, ptest will set ZF to 0 and 1
4071 // respectively.
4072 case kX64V64x2AllTrue: {
4073 ASSEMBLE_SIMD_ALL_TRUE(Pcmpeqq);
4074 break;
4075 }
4076 case kX64V32x4AllTrue: {
4077 ASSEMBLE_SIMD_ALL_TRUE(Pcmpeqd);
4078 break;
4079 }
4080 case kX64V16x8AllTrue: {
4081 ASSEMBLE_SIMD_ALL_TRUE(Pcmpeqw);
4082 break;
4083 }
4084 case kX64V8x16AllTrue: {
4085 ASSEMBLE_SIMD_ALL_TRUE(Pcmpeqb);
4086 break;
4087 }
4088 case kWord32AtomicExchangeInt8: {
4089 __ xchgb(i.InputRegister(0), i.MemoryOperand(1));
4090 __ movsxbl(i.InputRegister(0), i.InputRegister(0));
4091 break;
4092 }
4093 case kWord32AtomicExchangeUint8: {
4094 __ xchgb(i.InputRegister(0), i.MemoryOperand(1));
4095 __ movzxbl(i.InputRegister(0), i.InputRegister(0));
4096 break;
4097 }
4098 case kWord32AtomicExchangeInt16: {
4099 __ xchgw(i.InputRegister(0), i.MemoryOperand(1));
4100 __ movsxwl(i.InputRegister(0), i.InputRegister(0));
4101 break;
4102 }
4103 case kWord32AtomicExchangeUint16: {
4104 __ xchgw(i.InputRegister(0), i.MemoryOperand(1));
4105 __ movzxwl(i.InputRegister(0), i.InputRegister(0));
4106 break;
4107 }
4108 case kWord32AtomicExchangeWord32: {
4109 __ xchgl(i.InputRegister(0), i.MemoryOperand(1));
4110 break;
4111 }
4112 case kWord32AtomicCompareExchangeInt8: {
4113 __ lock();
4114 __ cmpxchgb(i.MemoryOperand(2), i.InputRegister(1));
4115 __ movsxbl(rax, rax);
4116 break;
4117 }
4118 case kWord32AtomicCompareExchangeUint8: {
4119 __ lock();
4120 __ cmpxchgb(i.MemoryOperand(2), i.InputRegister(1));
4121 __ movzxbl(rax, rax);
4122 break;
4123 }
4124 case kWord32AtomicCompareExchangeInt16: {
4125 __ lock();
4126 __ cmpxchgw(i.MemoryOperand(2), i.InputRegister(1));
4127 __ movsxwl(rax, rax);
4128 break;
4129 }
4130 case kWord32AtomicCompareExchangeUint16: {
4131 __ lock();
4132 __ cmpxchgw(i.MemoryOperand(2), i.InputRegister(1));
4133 __ movzxwl(rax, rax);
4134 break;
4135 }
4136 case kWord32AtomicCompareExchangeWord32: {
4137 __ lock();
4138 __ cmpxchgl(i.MemoryOperand(2), i.InputRegister(1));
4139 break;
4140 }
4141#define ATOMIC_BINOP_CASE(op, inst) \
4142 case kWord32Atomic##op##Int8: \
4143 ASSEMBLE_ATOMIC_BINOP(inst, movb, cmpxchgb); \
4144 __ movsxbl(rax, rax); \
4145 break; \
4146 case kWord32Atomic##op##Uint8: \
4147 ASSEMBLE_ATOMIC_BINOP(inst, movb, cmpxchgb); \
4148 __ movzxbl(rax, rax); \
4149 break; \
4150 case kWord32Atomic##op##Int16: \
4151 ASSEMBLE_ATOMIC_BINOP(inst, movw, cmpxchgw); \
4152 __ movsxwl(rax, rax); \
4153 break; \
4154 case kWord32Atomic##op##Uint16: \
4155 ASSEMBLE_ATOMIC_BINOP(inst, movw, cmpxchgw); \
4156 __ movzxwl(rax, rax); \
4157 break; \
4158 case kWord32Atomic##op##Word32: \
4159 ASSEMBLE_ATOMIC_BINOP(inst, movl, cmpxchgl); \
4160 break;
4161 ATOMIC_BINOP_CASE(Add, addl)
4162 ATOMIC_BINOP_CASE(Sub, subl)
4163 ATOMIC_BINOP_CASE(And, andl)
4164 ATOMIC_BINOP_CASE(Or, orl)
4165 ATOMIC_BINOP_CASE(Xor, xorl)
4166#undef ATOMIC_BINOP_CASE
4167 case kX64Word64AtomicExchangeUint8: {
4168 __ xchgb(i.InputRegister(0), i.MemoryOperand(1));
4169 __ movzxbq(i.InputRegister(0), i.InputRegister(0));
4170 break;
4171 }
4172 case kX64Word64AtomicExchangeUint16: {
4173 __ xchgw(i.InputRegister(0), i.MemoryOperand(1));
4174 __ movzxwq(i.InputRegister(0), i.InputRegister(0));
4175 break;
4176 }
4177 case kX64Word64AtomicExchangeUint32: {
4178 __ xchgl(i.InputRegister(0), i.MemoryOperand(1));
4179 break;
4180 }
4181 case kX64Word64AtomicExchangeUint64: {
4182 __ xchgq(i.InputRegister(0), i.MemoryOperand(1));
4183 break;
4184 }
4185 case kX64Word64AtomicCompareExchangeUint8: {
4186 __ lock();
4187 __ cmpxchgb(i.MemoryOperand(2), i.InputRegister(1));
4188 __ movzxbq(rax, rax);
4189 break;
4190 }
4191 case kX64Word64AtomicCompareExchangeUint16: {
4192 __ lock();
4193 __ cmpxchgw(i.MemoryOperand(2), i.InputRegister(1));
4194 __ movzxwq(rax, rax);
4195 break;
4196 }
4197 case kX64Word64AtomicCompareExchangeUint32: {
4198 __ lock();
4199 __ cmpxchgl(i.MemoryOperand(2), i.InputRegister(1));
4200 // Zero-extend the 32 bit value to 64 bit.
4201 __ movl(rax, rax);
4202 break;
4203 }
4204 case kX64Word64AtomicCompareExchangeUint64: {
4205 __ lock();
4206 __ cmpxchgq(i.MemoryOperand(2), i.InputRegister(1));
4207 break;
4208 }
4209#define ATOMIC64_BINOP_CASE(op, inst) \
4210 case kX64Word64Atomic##op##Uint8: \
4211 ASSEMBLE_ATOMIC64_BINOP(inst, movb, cmpxchgb); \
4212 __ movzxbq(rax, rax); \
4213 break; \
4214 case kX64Word64Atomic##op##Uint16: \
4215 ASSEMBLE_ATOMIC64_BINOP(inst, movw, cmpxchgw); \
4216 __ movzxwq(rax, rax); \
4217 break; \
4218 case kX64Word64Atomic##op##Uint32: \
4219 ASSEMBLE_ATOMIC64_BINOP(inst, movl, cmpxchgl); \
4220 break; \
4221 case kX64Word64Atomic##op##Uint64: \
4222 ASSEMBLE_ATOMIC64_BINOP(inst, movq, cmpxchgq); \
4223 break;
4224 ATOMIC64_BINOP_CASE(Add, addq)
4225 ATOMIC64_BINOP_CASE(Sub, subq)
4226 ATOMIC64_BINOP_CASE(And, andq)
4227 ATOMIC64_BINOP_CASE(Or, orq)
4228 ATOMIC64_BINOP_CASE(Xor, xorq)
4229#undef ATOMIC64_BINOP_CASE
4230 case kWord32AtomicLoadInt8:
4231 case kWord32AtomicLoadUint8:
4232 case kWord32AtomicLoadInt16:
4233 case kWord32AtomicLoadUint16:
4234 case kWord32AtomicLoadWord32:
4235 case kWord32AtomicStoreWord8:
4236 case kWord32AtomicStoreWord16:
4237 case kWord32AtomicStoreWord32:
4238 case kX64Word64AtomicLoadUint8:
4239 case kX64Word64AtomicLoadUint16:
4240 case kX64Word64AtomicLoadUint32:
4241 case kX64Word64AtomicLoadUint64:
4242 case kX64Word64AtomicStoreWord8:
4243 case kX64Word64AtomicStoreWord16:
4244 case kX64Word64AtomicStoreWord32:
4245 case kX64Word64AtomicStoreWord64:
4246 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code"); // Won't be generated by instruction selector.
4247 break;
4248 }
4249 return kSuccess;
4250} // NOLadability/fn_size)
4251
4252#undef ASSEMBLE_UNOP
4253#undef ASSEMBLE_BINOP
4254#undef ASSEMBLE_COMPARE
4255#undef ASSEMBLE_MULT
4256#undef ASSEMBLE_SHIFT
4257#undef ASSEMBLE_MOVX
4258#undef ASSEMBLE_SSE_BINOP
4259#undef ASSEMBLE_SSE_UNOP
4260#undef ASSEMBLE_AVX_BINOP
4261#undef ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_BINOP
4262#undef ASSEMBLE_IEEE754_UNOP
4263#undef ASSEMBLE_ATOMIC_BINOP
4264#undef ASSEMBLE_ATOMIC64_BINOP
4265#undef ASSEMBLE_SIMD_INSTR
4266#undef ASSEMBLE_SIMD_IMM_INSTR
4267#undef ASSEMBLE_SIMD_PUNPCK_SHUFFLE
4268#undef ASSEMBLE_SIMD_IMM_SHUFFLE
4269#undef ASSEMBLE_SIMD_ALL_TRUE
4270#undef ASSEMBLE_SIMD_SHIFT
4271
4272namespace {
4273
4274Condition FlagsConditionToCondition(FlagsCondition condition) {
4275 switch (condition) {
4276 case kUnorderedEqual:
4277 case kEqual:
4278 return equal;
4279 case kUnorderedNotEqual:
4280 case kNotEqual:
4281 return not_equal;
4282 case kSignedLessThan:
4283 return less;
4284 case kSignedGreaterThanOrEqual:
4285 return greater_equal;
4286 case kSignedLessThanOrEqual:
4287 return less_equal;
4288 case kSignedGreaterThan:
4289 return greater;
4290 case kUnsignedLessThan:
4291 return below;
4292 case kUnsignedGreaterThanOrEqual:
4293 return above_equal;
4294 case kUnsignedLessThanOrEqual:
4295 return below_equal;
4296 case kUnsignedGreaterThan:
4297 return above;
4298 case kOverflow:
4299 return overflow;
4300 case kNotOverflow:
4301 return no_overflow;
4302 default:
4303 break;
4304 }
4305 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
4306}
4307
4308} // namespace
4309
4310// Assembles branches after this instruction.
4311void CodeGenerator::AssembleArchBranch(Instruction* instr, BranchInfo* branch) {
4312 Label::Distance flabel_distance =
4313 branch->fallthru ? Label::kNear : Label::kFar;
4314 Label* tlabel = branch->true_label;
4315 Label* flabel = branch->false_label;
4316 if (branch->condition == kUnorderedEqual) {
4317 __ j(parity_even, flabel, flabel_distance);
4318 } else if (branch->condition == kUnorderedNotEqual) {
4319 __ j(parity_even, tlabel);
4320 }
4321 __ j(FlagsConditionToCondition(branch->condition), tlabel);
4322
4323 if (!branch->fallthru) __ jmp(flabel, flabel_distance);
4324}
4325
4326void CodeGenerator::AssembleBranchPoisoning(FlagsCondition condition,
4327 Instruction* instr) {
4328 // TODO(jarin) Handle float comparisons (kUnordered[Not]Equal).
4329 if (condition == kUnorderedEqual || condition == kUnorderedNotEqual) {
4330 return;
4331 }
4332
4333 condition = NegateFlagsCondition(condition);
4334 __ movl(kScratchRegister, Immediate(0));
4335 __ cmovq(FlagsConditionToCondition(condition), kSpeculationPoisonRegister,
4336 kScratchRegister);
4337}
4338
4339void CodeGenerator::AssembleArchDeoptBranch(Instruction* instr,
4340 BranchInfo* branch) {
4341 Label::Distance flabel_distance =
4342 branch->fallthru ? Label::kNear : Label::kFar;
4343 Label* tlabel = branch->true_label;
4344 Label* flabel = branch->false_label;
4345 Label nodeopt;
4346 if (branch->condition == kUnorderedEqual) {
4347 __ j(parity_even, flabel, flabel_distance);
4348 } else if (branch->condition == kUnorderedNotEqual) {
4349 __ j(parity_even, tlabel);
4350 }
4351 __ j(FlagsConditionToCondition(branch->condition), tlabel);
4352
4353 if (FLAG_deopt_every_n_times > 0) {
4354 ExternalReference counter =
4355 ExternalReference::stress_deopt_count(isolate());
4356
4357 __ pushfq();
4358 __ pushq(rax);
4359 __ load_rax(counter);
4360 __ decl(rax);
4361 __ j(not_zero, &nodeopt, Label::kNear);
4362
4363 __ Set(rax, FLAG_deopt_every_n_times);
4364 __ store_rax(counter);
4365 __ popq(rax);
4366 __ popfq();
4367 __ jmp(tlabel);
4368
4369 __ bind(&nodeopt);
4370 __ store_rax(counter);
4371 __ popq(rax);
4372 __ popfq();
4373 }
4374
4375 if (!branch->fallthru) {
4376 __ jmp(flabel, flabel_distance);
4377 }
4378}
4379
4380void CodeGenerator::AssembleArchJump(RpoNumber target) {
4381 if (!IsNextInAssemblyOrder(target)) __ jmp(GetLabel(target));
4382}
4383
4384void CodeGenerator::AssembleArchTrap(Instruction* instr,
4385 FlagsCondition condition) {
4386 auto ool = zone()->New<WasmOutOfLineTrap>(this, instr);
4387 Label* tlabel = ool->entry();
4388 Label end;
4389 if (condition == kUnorderedEqual) {
4390 __ j(parity_even, &end, Label::kNear);
4391 } else if (condition == kUnorderedNotEqual) {
4392 __ j(parity_even, tlabel);
4393 }
4394 __ j(FlagsConditionToCondition(condition), tlabel);
4395 __ bind(&end);
4396}
4397
4398// Assembles boolean materializations after this instruction.
4399void CodeGenerator::AssembleArchBoolean(Instruction* instr,
4400 FlagsCondition condition) {
4401 X64OperandConverter i(this, instr);
4402 Label done;
4403
4404 // Materialize a full 64-bit 1 or 0 value. The result register is always the
4405 // last output of the instruction.
4406 Label check;
4407 DCHECK_NE(0u, instr->OutputCount())((void) 0);
4408 Register reg = i.OutputRegister(instr->OutputCount() - 1);
4409 if (condition == kUnorderedEqual) {
4410 __ j(parity_odd, &check, Label::kNear);
4411 __ movl(reg, Immediate(0));
4412 __ jmp(&done, Label::kNear);
4413 } else if (condition == kUnorderedNotEqual) {
4414 __ j(parity_odd, &check, Label::kNear);
4415 __ movl(reg, Immediate(1));
4416 __ jmp(&done, Label::kNear);
4417 }
4418 __ bind(&check);
4419 __ setcc(FlagsConditionToCondition(condition), reg);
4420 __ movzxbl(reg, reg);
4421 __ bind(&done);
4422}
4423
4424void CodeGenerator::AssembleArchBinarySearchSwitch(Instruction* instr) {
4425 X64OperandConverter i(this, instr);
4426 Register input = i.InputRegister(0);
4427 std::vector<std::pair<int32_t, Label*>> cases;
4428 for (size_t index = 2; index < instr->InputCount(); index += 2) {
4429 cases.push_back({i.InputInt32(index + 0), GetLabel(i.InputRpo(index + 1))});
4430 }
4431 AssembleArchBinarySearchSwitchRange(input, i.InputRpo(1), cases.data(),
4432 cases.data() + cases.size());
4433}
4434
4435void CodeGenerator::AssembleArchTableSwitch(Instruction* instr) {
4436 X64OperandConverter i(this, instr);
4437 Register input = i.InputRegister(0);
4438 int32_t const case_count = static_cast<int32_t>(instr->InputCount() - 2);
4439 Label** cases = zone()->NewArray<Label*>(case_count);
4440 for (int32_t index = 0; index < case_count; ++index) {
4441 cases[index] = GetLabel(i.InputRpo(index + 2));
4442 }
4443 Label* const table = AddJumpTable(cases, case_count);
4444 __ cmpl(input, Immediate(case_count));
4445 __ j(above_equal, GetLabel(i.InputRpo(1)));
4446 __ leaq(kScratchRegister, Operand(table));
4447 __ jmp(Operand(kScratchRegister, input, times_8, 0));
4448}
4449
4450namespace {
4451
4452static const int kQuadWordSize = 16;
4453
4454} // namespace
4455
4456void CodeGenerator::FinishFrame(Frame* frame) {
4457 auto call_descriptor = linkage()->GetIncomingDescriptor();
4458
4459 const RegList saves_fp = call_descriptor->CalleeSavedFPRegisters();
4460 if (saves_fp != 0) {
4461 frame->AlignSavedCalleeRegisterSlots();
4462 if (saves_fp != 0) { // Save callee-saved XMM registers.
4463 const uint32_t saves_fp_count = base::bits::CountPopulation(saves_fp);
4464 frame->AllocateSavedCalleeRegisterSlots(
4465 saves_fp_count * (kQuadWordSize / kSystemPointerSize));
4466 }
4467 }
4468 const RegList saves = call_descriptor->CalleeSavedRegisters();
4469 if (saves != 0) { // Save callee-saved registers.
4470 int count = 0;
4471 for (int i = Register::kNumRegisters - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
4472 if (((1 << i) & saves)) {
4473 ++count;
4474 }
4475 }
4476 frame->AllocateSavedCalleeRegisterSlots(count);
4477 }
4478}
4479
4480void CodeGenerator::AssembleConstructFrame() {
4481 auto call_descriptor = linkage()->GetIncomingDescriptor();
4482 if (frame_access_state()->has_frame()) {
4483 int pc_base = __ pc_offset();
4484
4485 if (call_descriptor->IsCFunctionCall()) {
4486 __ pushq(rbp);
4487 __ movq(rbp, rsp);
4488 if (info()->GetOutputStackFrameType() == StackFrame::C_WASM_ENTRY) {
4489 __ Push(Immediate(StackFrame::TypeToMarker(StackFrame::C_WASM_ENTRY)));
4490 // Reserve stack space for saving the c_entry_fp later.
4491 __ AllocateStackSpace(kSystemPointerSize);
4492 }
4493 } else if (call_descriptor->IsJSFunctionCall()) {
4494 __ Prologue();
4495 if (call_descriptor->PushArgumentCount()) {
4496 __ pushq(kJavaScriptCallArgCountRegister);
4497 }
4498 } else {
4499 __ StubPrologue(info()->GetOutputStackFrameType());
4500 if (call_descriptor->IsWasmFunctionCall()) {
4501 __ pushq(kWasmInstanceRegister);
4502 } else if (call_descriptor->IsWasmImportWrapper() ||
4503 call_descriptor->IsWasmCapiFunction()) {
4504 // Wasm import wrappers are passed a tuple in the place of the instance.
4505 // Unpack the tuple into the instance and the target callable.
4506 // This must be done here in the codegen because it cannot be expressed
4507 // properly in the graph.
4508 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
4509 kJSFunctionRegister,
4510 FieldOperand(kWasmInstanceRegister, Tuple2::kValue2Offset));
4511 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
4512 kWasmInstanceRegister,
4513 FieldOperand(kWasmInstanceRegister, Tuple2::kValue1Offset));
4514 __ pushq(kWasmInstanceRegister);
4515 if (call_descriptor->IsWasmCapiFunction()) {
4516 // Reserve space for saving the PC later.
4517 __ AllocateStackSpace(kSystemPointerSize);
4518 }
4519 }
4520 }
4521
4522 unwinding_info_writer_.MarkFrameConstructed(pc_base);
4523 }
4524 int required_slots =
4525 frame()->GetTotalFrameSlotCount() - frame()->GetFixedSlotCount();
4526
4527 if (info()->is_osr()) {
4528 // TurboFan OSR-compiled functions cannot be entered directly.
4529 __ Abort(AbortReason::kShouldNotDirectlyEnterOsrFunction);
4530
4531 // Unoptimized code jumps directly to this entrypoint while the unoptimized
4532 // frame is still on the stack. Optimized code uses OSR values directly from
4533 // the unoptimized frame. Thus, all that needs to be done is to allocate the
4534 // remaining stack slots.
4535 if (FLAG_code_comments) __ RecordComment("-- OSR entrypoint --");
4536 osr_pc_offset_ = __ pc_offset();
4537 required_slots -= static_cast<int>(osr_helper()->UnoptimizedFrameSlots());
4538 ResetSpeculationPoison();
4539 }
4540
4541 const RegList saves = call_descriptor->CalleeSavedRegisters();
4542 const RegList saves_fp = call_descriptor->CalleeSavedFPRegisters();
4543
4544 if (required_slots > 0) {
4545 DCHECK(frame_access_state()->has_frame())((void) 0);
4546 if (info()->IsWasm() && required_slots > 128) {
4547 // For WebAssembly functions with big frames we have to do the stack
4548 // overflow check before we construct the frame. Otherwise we may not
4549 // have enough space on the stack to call the runtime for the stack
4550 // overflow.
4551 Label done;
4552
4553 // If the frame is bigger than the stack, we throw the stack overflow
4554 // exception unconditionally. Thereby we can avoid the integer overflow
4555 // check in the condition code.
4556 if (required_slots * kSystemPointerSize < FLAG_stack_size * 1024) {
4557 __ movq(kScratchRegister,
4558 FieldOperand(kWasmInstanceRegister,
4559 WasmInstanceObject::kRealStackLimitAddressOffset));
4560 __ movq(kScratchRegister, Operand(kScratchRegister, 0));
4561 __ addq(kScratchRegister,
4562 Immediate(required_slots * kSystemPointerSize));
4563 __ cmpq(rsp, kScratchRegister);
4564 __ j(above_equal, &done, Label::kNear);
4565 }
4566
4567 __ near_call(wasm::WasmCode::kWasmStackOverflow,
4568 RelocInfo::WASM_STUB_CALL);
4569 ReferenceMap* reference_map = zone()->New<ReferenceMap>(zone());
4570 RecordSafepoint(reference_map, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
4571 __ AssertUnreachable(AbortReason::kUnexpectedReturnFromWasmTrap);
4572 __ bind(&done);
4573 }
4574
4575 // Skip callee-saved and return slots, which are created below.
4576 required_slots -= base::bits::CountPopulation(saves);
4577 required_slots -= base::bits::CountPopulation(saves_fp) *
4578 (kQuadWordSize / kSystemPointerSize);
4579 required_slots -= frame()->GetReturnSlotCount();
4580 if (required_slots > 0) {
4581 __ AllocateStackSpace(required_slots * kSystemPointerSize);
4582 }
4583 }
4584
4585 if (saves_fp != 0) { // Save callee-saved XMM registers.
4586 const uint32_t saves_fp_count = base::bits::CountPopulation(saves_fp);
4587 const int stack_size = saves_fp_count * kQuadWordSize;
4588 // Adjust the stack pointer.
4589 __ AllocateStackSpace(stack_size);
4590 // Store the registers on the stack.
4591 int slot_idx = 0;
4592 for (int i = 0; i < XMMRegister::kNumRegisters; i++) {
4593 if (!((1 << i) & saves_fp)) continue;
4594 __ Movdqu(Operand(rsp, kQuadWordSize * slot_idx),
4595 XMMRegister::from_code(i));
4596 slot_idx++;
4597 }
4598 }
4599
4600 if (saves != 0) { // Save callee-saved registers.
4601 for (int i = Register::kNumRegisters - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
4602 if (!((1 << i) & saves)) continue;
4603 __ pushq(Register::from_code(i));
4604 }
4605 }
4606
4607 // Allocate return slots (located after callee-saved).
4608 if (frame()->GetReturnSlotCount() > 0) {
4609 __ AllocateStackSpace(frame()->GetReturnSlotCount() * kSystemPointerSize);
4610 }
4611}
4612
4613void CodeGenerator::AssembleReturn(InstructionOperand* pop) {
4614 auto call_descriptor = linkage()->GetIncomingDescriptor();
4615
4616 // Restore registers.
4617 const RegList saves = call_descriptor->CalleeSavedRegisters();
4618 if (saves != 0) {
4619 const int returns = frame()->GetReturnSlotCount();
4620 if (returns != 0) {
4621 __ addq(rsp, Immediate(returns * kSystemPointerSize));
4622 }
4623 for (int i = 0; i < Register::kNumRegisters; i++) {
4624 if (!((1 << i) & saves)) continue;
4625 __ popq(Register::from_code(i));
4626 }
4627 }
4628 const RegList saves_fp = call_descriptor->CalleeSavedFPRegisters();
4629 if (saves_fp != 0) {
4630 const uint32_t saves_fp_count = base::bits::CountPopulation(saves_fp);
4631 const int stack_size = saves_fp_count * kQuadWordSize;
4632 // Load the registers from the stack.
4633 int slot_idx = 0;
4634 for (int i = 0; i < XMMRegister::kNumRegisters; i++) {
4635 if (!((1 << i) & saves_fp)) continue;
4636 __ Movdqu(XMMRegister::from_code(i),
4637 Operand(rsp, kQuadWordSize * slot_idx));
4638 slot_idx++;
4639 }
4640 // Adjust the stack pointer.
4641 __ addq(rsp, Immediate(stack_size));
4642 }
4643
4644 unwinding_info_writer_.MarkBlockWillExit();
4645
4646 // Might need rcx for scratch if pop_size is too big or if there is a variable
4647 // pop count.
4648 DCHECK_EQ(0u, call_descriptor->CalleeSavedRegisters() & rcx.bit())((void) 0);
4649 DCHECK_EQ(0u, call_descriptor->CalleeSavedRegisters() & rdx.bit())((void) 0);
4650 size_t pop_size = call_descriptor->StackParameterCount() * kSystemPointerSize;
4651 X64OperandConverter g(this, nullptr);
4652 if (call_descriptor->IsCFunctionCall()) {
4653 AssembleDeconstructFrame();
4654 } else if (frame_access_state()->has_frame()) {
4655 if (pop->IsImmediate() && g.ToConstant(pop).ToInt32() == 0) {
4656 // Canonicalize JSFunction return sites for now.
4657 if (return_label_.is_bound()) {
4658 __ jmp(&return_label_);
4659 return;
4660 } else {
4661 __ bind(&return_label_);
4662 AssembleDeconstructFrame();
4663 }
4664 } else {
4665 AssembleDeconstructFrame();
4666 }
4667 }
4668
4669 if (pop->IsImmediate()) {
4670 pop_size += g.ToConstant(pop).ToInt32() * kSystemPointerSize;
4671 CHECK_LT(pop_size, static_cast<size_t>(std::numeric_limits<int>::max()))do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpLTImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(pop_size)>::type, typename
::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(static_cast<size_t
>(std::numeric_limits<int>::max()))>::type>((pop_size
), (static_cast<size_t>(std::numeric_limits<int>::
max()))); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp)), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "pop_size" " " "<" " " "static_cast<size_t>(std::numeric_limits<int>::max())"
); } } while (false); } while (false);
4672 __ Ret(static_cast<int>(pop_size), rcx);
4673 } else {
4674 Register pop_reg = g.ToRegister(pop);
4675 Register scratch_reg = pop_reg == rcx ? rdx : rcx;
4676 __ popq(scratch_reg);
4677 __ leaq(rsp, Operand(rsp, pop_reg, times_8, static_cast<int>(pop_size)));
4678 __ jmp(scratch_reg);
4679 }
4680}
4681
4682void CodeGenerator::FinishCode() { tasm()->PatchConstPool(); }
4683
4684void CodeGenerator::PrepareForDeoptimizationExits(int deopt_count) {}
4685
4686void CodeGenerator::IncrementStackAccessCounter(
4687 InstructionOperand* source, InstructionOperand* destination) {
4688 DCHECK(FLAG_trace_turbo_stack_accesses)((void) 0);
4689 if (!info()->IsOptimizing() && !info()->IsWasm()) return;
4690 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(debug_name_)((void) 0);
4691 auto IncrementCounter = [&](ExternalReference counter) {
4692 __ incl(__ ExternalReferenceAsOperand(counter));
4693 };
4694 if (source->IsAnyStackSlot()) {
4695 IncrementCounter(
4696 ExternalReference::address_of_load_from_stack_count(debug_name_));
4697 }
4698 if (destination->IsAnyStackSlot()) {
4699 IncrementCounter(
4700 ExternalReference::address_of_store_to_stack_count(debug_name_));
4701 }
4702}
4703
4704void CodeGenerator::AssembleMove(InstructionOperand* source,
4705 InstructionOperand* destination) {
4706 X64OperandConverter g(this, nullptr);
4707 // Helper function to write the given constant to the dst register.
4708 auto MoveConstantToRegister = [&](Register dst, Constant src) {
4709 switch (src.type()) {
4710 case Constant::kInt32: {
4711 if (RelocInfo::IsWasmReference(src.rmode())) {
4712 __ movq(dst, Immediate64(src.ToInt64(), src.rmode()));
4713 } else {
4714 int32_t value = src.ToInt32();
4715 if (value == 0) {
4716 __ xorl(dst, dst);
4717 } else {
4718 __ movl(dst, Immediate(value));
4719 }
4720 }
4721 break;
4722 }
4723 case Constant::kInt64:
4724 if (RelocInfo::IsWasmReference(src.rmode())) {
4725 __ movq(dst, Immediate64(src.ToInt64(), src.rmode()));
4726 } else {
4727 __ Set(dst, src.ToInt64());
4728 }
4729 break;
4730 case Constant::kFloat32:
4731 __ MoveNumber(dst, src.ToFloat32());
4732 break;
4733 case Constant::kFloat64:
4734 __ MoveNumber(dst, src.ToFloat64().value());
4735 break;
4736 case Constant::kExternalReference:
4737 __ Move(dst, src.ToExternalReference());
4738 break;
4739 case Constant::kHeapObject: {
4740 Handle<HeapObject> src_object = src.ToHeapObject();
4741 RootIndex index;
4742 if (IsMaterializableFromRoot(src_object, &index)) {
4743 __ LoadRoot(dst, index);
4744 } else {
4745 __ Move(dst, src_object);
4746 }
4747 break;
4748 }
4749 case Constant::kCompressedHeapObject: {
4750 Handle<HeapObject> src_object = src.ToHeapObject();
4751 RootIndex index;
4752 if (IsMaterializableFromRoot(src_object, &index)) {
4753 __ LoadRoot(dst, index);
4754 } else {
4755 __ Move(dst, src_object, RelocInfo::COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT);
4756 }
4757 break;
4758 }
4759 case Constant::kDelayedStringConstant: {
4760 const StringConstantBase* src_constant = src.ToDelayedStringConstant();
4761 __ MoveStringConstant(dst, src_constant);
4762 break;
4763 }
4764 case Constant::kRpoNumber:
4765 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code"); // TODO(dcarney): load of labels on x64.
4766 break;
4767 }
4768 };
4769 // Helper function to write the given constant to the stack.
4770 auto MoveConstantToSlot = [&](Operand dst, Constant src) {
4771 if (!RelocInfo::IsWasmReference(src.rmode())) {
4772 switch (src.type()) {
4773 case Constant::kInt32:
4774 __ movq(dst, Immediate(src.ToInt32()));
4775 return;
4776 case Constant::kInt64:
4777 __ Set(dst, src.ToInt64());
4778 return;
4779 default:
4780 break;
4781 }
4782 }
4783 MoveConstantToRegister(kScratchRegister, src);
4784 __ movq(dst, kScratchRegister);
4785 };
4786
4787 if (FLAG_trace_turbo_stack_accesses) {
4788 IncrementStackAccessCounter(source, destination);
4789 }
4790
4791 // Dispatch on the source and destination operand kinds.
4792 switch (MoveType::InferMove(source, destination)) {
4793 case MoveType::kRegisterToRegister:
4794 if (source->IsRegister()) {
4795 __ movq(g.ToRegister(destination), g.ToRegister(source));
4796 } else {
4797 DCHECK(source->IsFPRegister())((void) 0);
4798 __ Movapd(g.ToDoubleRegister(destination), g.ToDoubleRegister(source));
4799 }
4800 return;
4801 case MoveType::kRegisterToStack: {
4802 Operand dst = g.ToOperand(destination);
4803 if (source->IsRegister()) {
4804 __ movq(dst, g.ToRegister(source));
4805 } else {
4806 DCHECK(source->IsFPRegister())((void) 0);
4807 XMMRegister src = g.ToDoubleRegister(source);
4808 MachineRepresentation rep =
4809 LocationOperand::cast(source)->representation();
4810 if (rep != MachineRepresentation::kSimd128) {
4811 __ Movsd(dst, src);
4812 } else {
4813 __ Movups(dst, src);
4814 }
4815 }
4816 return;
4817 }
4818 case MoveType::kStackToRegister: {
4819 Operand src = g.ToOperand(source);
4820 if (source->IsStackSlot()) {
4821 __ movq(g.ToRegister(destination), src);
4822 } else {
4823 DCHECK(source->IsFPStackSlot())((void) 0);
4824 XMMRegister dst = g.ToDoubleRegister(destination);
4825 MachineRepresentation rep =
4826 LocationOperand::cast(source)->representation();
4827 if (rep != MachineRepresentation::kSimd128) {
4828 __ Movsd(dst, src);
4829 } else {
4830 __ Movups(dst, src);
4831 }
4832 }
4833 return;
4834 }
4835 case MoveType::kStackToStack: {
4836 Operand src = g.ToOperand(source);
4837 Operand dst = g.ToOperand(destination);
4838 if (source->IsStackSlot()) {
4839 // Spill on demand to use a temporary register for memory-to-memory
4840 // moves.
4841 __ movq(kScratchRegister, src);
4842 __ movq(dst, kScratchRegister);
4843 } else {
4844 MachineRepresentation rep =
4845 LocationOperand::cast(source)->representation();
4846 if (rep != MachineRepresentation::kSimd128) {
4847 __ Movsd(kScratchDoubleReg, src);
4848 __ Movsd(dst, kScratchDoubleReg);
4849 } else {
4850 DCHECK(source->IsSimd128StackSlot())((void) 0);
4851 __ Movups(kScratchDoubleReg, src);
4852 __ Movups(dst, kScratchDoubleReg);
4853 }
4854 }
4855 return;
4856 }
4857 case MoveType::kConstantToRegister: {
4858 Constant src = g.ToConstant(source);
4859 if (destination->IsRegister()) {
4860 MoveConstantToRegister(g.ToRegister(destination), src);
4861 } else {
4862 DCHECK(destination->IsFPRegister())((void) 0);
4863 XMMRegister dst = g.ToDoubleRegister(destination);
4864 if (src.type() == Constant::kFloat32) {
4865 // TODO(turbofan): Can we do better here?
4866 __ Move(dst, bit_cast<uint32_t>(src.ToFloat32()));
4867 } else {
4868 DCHECK_EQ(src.type(), Constant::kFloat64)((void) 0);
4869 __ Move(dst, src.ToFloat64().AsUint64());
4870 }
4871 }
4872 return;
4873 }
4874 case MoveType::kConstantToStack: {
4875 Constant src = g.ToConstant(source);
4876 Operand dst = g.ToOperand(destination);
4877 if (destination->IsStackSlot()) {
4878 MoveConstantToSlot(dst, src);
4879 } else {
4880 DCHECK(destination->IsFPStackSlot())((void) 0);
4881 if (src.type() == Constant::kFloat32) {
4882 __ movl(dst, Immediate(bit_cast<uint32_t>(src.ToFloat32())));
4883 } else {
4884 DCHECK_EQ(src.type(), Constant::kFloat64)((void) 0);
4885 __ movq(kScratchRegister, src.ToFloat64().AsUint64());
4886 __ movq(dst, kScratchRegister);
4887 }
4888 }
4889 return;
4890 }
4891 }
4892 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
4893}
4894
4895void CodeGenerator::AssembleSwap(InstructionOperand* source,
4896 InstructionOperand* destination) {
4897 if (FLAG_trace_turbo_stack_accesses) {
1
Assuming 'FLAG_trace_turbo_stack_accesses' is false
→
2
←
Taking false branch
→
4898 IncrementStackAccessCounter(source, destination);
4899 IncrementStackAccessCounter(destination, source);
4900 }
4901
4902 X64OperandConverter g(this, nullptr);
4903 // Dispatch on the source and destination operand kinds. Not all
4904 // combinations are possible.
4905 switch (MoveType::InferSwap(source, destination)) {
3
←
Control jumps to 'case kStackToStack:' at line 4953
→
4906 case MoveType::kRegisterToRegister: {
4907 if (source->IsRegister()) {
4908 Register src = g.ToRegister(source);
4909 Register dst = g.ToRegister(destination);
4910 __ movq(kScratchRegister, src);
4911 __ movq(src, dst);
4912 __ movq(dst, kScratchRegister);
4913 } else {
4914 DCHECK(source->IsFPRegister())((void) 0);
4915 XMMRegister src = g.ToDoubleRegister(source);
4916 XMMRegister dst = g.ToDoubleRegister(destination);
4917 __ Movapd(kScratchDoubleReg, src);
4918 __ Movapd(src, dst);
4919 __ Movapd(dst, kScratchDoubleReg);
4920 }
4921 return;
4922 }
4923 case MoveType::kRegisterToStack: {
4924 if (source->IsRegister()) {
4925 Register src = g.ToRegister(source);
4926 __ pushq(src);
4927 frame_access_state()->IncreaseSPDelta(1);
4928 unwinding_info_writer_.MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
4929 kSystemPointerSize);
4930 __ movq(src, g.ToOperand(destination));
4931 frame_access_state()->IncreaseSPDelta(-1);
4932 __ popq(g.ToOperand(destination));
4933 unwinding_info_writer_.MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
4934 -kSystemPointerSize);
4935 } else {
4936 DCHECK(source->IsFPRegister())((void) 0);
4937 XMMRegister src = g.ToDoubleRegister(source);
4938 Operand dst = g.ToOperand(destination);
4939 MachineRepresentation rep =
4940 LocationOperand::cast(source)->representation();
4941 if (rep != MachineRepresentation::kSimd128) {
4942 __ Movsd(kScratchDoubleReg, src);
4943 __ Movsd(src, dst);
4944 __ Movsd(dst, kScratchDoubleReg);
4945 } else {
4946 __ Movups(kScratchDoubleReg, src);
4947 __ Movups(src, dst);
4948 __ Movups(dst, kScratchDoubleReg);
4949 }
4950 }
4951 return;
4952 }
4953 case MoveType::kStackToStack: {
4954 Operand src = g.ToOperand(source);
4
←
Calling 'X64OperandConverter::ToOperand'
→
4955 Operand dst = g.ToOperand(destination);
4956 MachineRepresentation rep =
4957 LocationOperand::cast(source)->representation();
4958 if (rep != MachineRepresentation::kSimd128) {
4959 Register tmp = kScratchRegister;
4960 __ movq(tmp, dst);
4961 __ pushq(src); // Then use stack to copy src to destination.
4962 unwinding_info_writer_.MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
4963 kSystemPointerSize);
4964 __ popq(dst);
4965 unwinding_info_writer_.MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
4966 -kSystemPointerSize);
4967 __ movq(src, tmp);
4968 } else {
4969 // Without AVX, misaligned reads and writes will trap. Move using the
4970 // stack, in two parts.
4971 __ movups(kScratchDoubleReg, dst); // Save dst in scratch register.
4972 __ pushq(src); // Then use stack to copy src to destination.
4973 unwinding_info_writer_.MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
4974 kSystemPointerSize);
4975 __ popq(dst);
4976 unwinding_info_writer_.MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
4977 -kSystemPointerSize);
4978 __ pushq(g.ToOperand(source, kSystemPointerSize));
4979 unwinding_info_writer_.MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
4980 kSystemPointerSize);
4981 __ popq(g.ToOperand(destination, kSystemPointerSize));
4982 unwinding_info_writer_.MaybeIncreaseBaseOffsetAt(__ pc_offset(),
4983 -kSystemPointerSize);
4984 __ movups(src, kScratchDoubleReg);
4985 }
4986 return;
4987 }
4988 default:
4989 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
4990 }
4991}
4992
4993void CodeGenerator::AssembleJumpTable(Label** targets, size_t target_count) {
4994 for (size_t index = 0; index < target_count; ++index) {
4995 __ dq(targets[index]);
4996 }
4997}
4998
4999#undef __
5000
5001} // namespace compiler
5002} // namespace internal
5003} // namespace v8
